text2: Shinajpi cungaimanda allpa shinzhira cuyuca ; shinarasha chonda cular shayachishca rumiuna cuyunauca . Chi ratollai tucui punguuna pascarinauca , tucui runaunara huatashca cadenauna pitirisha urmanaucami .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Chonda cular cuiraj runa lliccharisha , chonda cular punguuna pascarishcara ricuca . Paihua esparara llucchisha , paillara huañungarauca , ishcashca runauna miticunaushca anga iyasha .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: Pabloga shinzhira caparisha nica : Huañunara ama iyaichu , tucui caillai manchi .

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Cuiraj runa velara mañasha , ucuma icuca , manzharisha Pablo Silaspa chaquii tuama urmaca .

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: Paigunara canzhama lucchisha tapuca : Señores , nisha , ¿ Imara ranara ministini ñuca quishpingaj ?

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: Paiguna ninauca : Señor Jesucristoi quiri , quirisha quishpi tucungui , shinallara camba aillus .

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Shina rasha Diospa shimira rimanauca , paita paihua huasii tiajgunandi .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Chi tuta horasllaira paigunara pushasha , chugrichishcaunara maillaca . Chi ratollai bautisaricami , pai tucui paihua huasii tiajgunandi .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Paigunara paihua huasima pushasha micunara caraca . Shinallara cushiyanauca pais tucui paihua huasü tiajgunandi Diospi quirishcamanda .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Punzhayashcai apuuna soldarounara cachanauca : Chi runaunara cacharinauchu , nisha .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Chonda cularda cuiraj runa Pablora cuentaca : Apuuna cangunara cacharingaj cachamunaushca , nisha . Shinajpi llucshichi , cushihua richi .

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo paigunara nica : Tucuihua ñaupajpi mana taripasha ñucanchira Uvachinaucami , Romanosguna ashallara . Maspas ñucanchira chonda cularbi ishcahuanauca . Cuna randi , ñucanchira pacalla llucchina munanaun . Mana pacha . Paigunallara shamunauchu ñucanchira llucchingaj .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Soldarouna tigrasha apuunama cai shimunara rimai rinauca . Paiguna cai runauna Romanosguna ajgunara uyasha manzharinauca .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Shamusha ruganauca . Pablounara chonda cularmanda llucchisha llactamanda llucshingaj rimanauca .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Shina rasha , chonda cularmanda llucshisha , Lidia huasii icunauca . Uquiunara ricusha , paigunara cushiyachinauca . Chi huasha rinauca .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: Amfípolis Apolonia nishca llactaunara pasasha , Tesalónica nishca llactama pactanauca . Chihui shu judioguna tandarina huasi tiaca .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: Pablo paihua yachaira rasha paigunajma rica . Quinsa samana punzhara Diospa shimimanda paigunahua rimaca .

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Quillcashcaunamanda ricuchisha yachachica imasnara Cristo tormendarina aca , huañushcaunamandas causarina aca . Pablo nica : Cai ñuca cangunama rimaushca Jesús quiquin Cristomi .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Paigunamanda huaquinguna quirinauca , Pablohua Silashuas llutarinauca , ashca Diosta llaquij griegounandi , valij huarmiunandis mana ansallauna .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: Shinajpi mana quirij judioguna piñarisha , paigunahua pariju huaquin quilla runaunara manali runaunaras tandachinauca . Entero llactara nuspachinauca . Jasomba huasima shamunauca macanungaj . Pablora Silasdas llucchinara munanauca runaunajma .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: Astaumbas , paigunara mana tupasha , Jasonda huaquin quirij uquiunandi apuunajma aisasha pushanauca , caparisha : Cai runauna entero cai pachara tormendachijguna caimas shamunaushca , ninauca .

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Jasón cai runaunara apishcami . Tucui caiguna , César mandashcaunara mana pactachinaun , shu rey apu tiaunmi ninaun , Jesús nishca .

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Judioguna runaunara apuunaras nuspachinauca , cai shimiunara uyajpi .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Jasón shujgunandi , shimira cushca huasha cachari tucunauca .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Uquiuna dsaslla , chi tutallaira , Pablora Silasdas Berea llactama cachanauca . Paiguna pactai risha judioguna tandarina huasima icunauca .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Caiguna Tesalonicaunamanda yali valijguna anauca . Ali shunguhua shimira uyanauca . Caran punzha Quillcashcaunara ricunauca , cai shimiuna alichu manzhu ali nisha .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: Shinajpi paigunamanda ashcauna quirinauca , valij griego huarmiunas , mana ansalla cariunas .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Tesalonicamanda judioguna uyanauca imasna Berea llactais Pablo Diospa shimira rimashca aca . Chimas risha entero llactara nuspachigrinauca .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Chi ratollaira uquiuna Pablora lamar partima cachanauca . Silas Timoteo chillai saquirinauca .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Pablora pushajguna Atenas llactagama paita pushanauca . Pablo shimira cachaca Süasma Timoteomas uctalla shamunauchu , nisha . Runauna caita uyasha rinauca .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: Pablo Atenas llactai paigunara chapausha , yapa llaquiricami paihua almai , runa rashca diosgunara tucui partii ricusha .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Shinajpi judioguna tandarina huasii rimaca , judiogunahua Diosta llaquijgunahuas . Shinallara pulasai caran punzha tuparijgunahua rimaca .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Huaquin yachajguna paihua rimanauca . Huaquinguna ninauca : ¿ Imara nin cai shimisapa ? Shujguna ninauca : Pai carumanda supaiguna shutira camachisha shamun , yachin , pai Jesuspa evangelio ali shimiras causarinaras rimashcamanda .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Runauna Pablora apisha , paita Areópago nishca pulasama pushanauca , shina nisha : ¿ Ushanchichu uyangaj can rimaushca mushuj yachachishcara ?

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: Ñucanchi mana uyaushca shimira rimaj shamungui . Caita yachashun ninchi imara nin .

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: Tucui Atenas llactai causajgunas carumanda shamusha tiajgunas ima mushuj shimillara uyanaras rimanaras munanauca .

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo Areópago nishca pulasai shayarisha nica : Atenas runauna , canguna diosgunara yapa alabaisiqui ajgunara ricuni .

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: Nambira pasausha , canguna alabaushcaunara ricucani . Shu altar nishcara tupacani casna quillcashcahua : Mana ricsishca Dios , nisha . Cai Diosta canguna mana ricsisha alabajpi , caita cangunara rimauni .

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: Cai pachara raj Dios , tucui chihui tiajgunaras iñachij , pai ahua pacha cai pacha Dios asha , maquihua rashca huasiunai mana causaunzhu .

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: Runa maquimanda mana sirvi tucun , pai imaras ministiujsna . Pai tucuima causairas samairas tucui imaras cun .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: Shu yahuarmandalla tucui runara iñachicami , entero cai pachai causanauchu . Paiguna causana punzhaunaras allpaunaras ñaupa horasmanda pacha cushcami .

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: Shinajpi runauna Diosta mascanauchu imasna tonois rasha tupanauchu . Cierto pacha caran ñucanchimanda pai mana caruichu .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: Paihuajpi causanchi , purinchi , tiaunchi ; imasna huaquinguna canguna quiquin rimajguna rimashcasna : Ñucanchis paimanda mirajguna manchi .

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Diospajmanda miraiguna asha , Diosta curihua cullquihua rumihua rashca samira ama iyashunchi , runa iyaushca samira .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Dios cai iyai illaj horasgunara mana riparasha , cuna mandan tucui runaunara tucui partiunai arrepentirinauchu .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Chimandami shu punzhara cushca , pai ajllashca Runa ali shunguhua cai pachara taripangaj . Cai tucui cierto ajta tucui runaunama ricuchingaj cai Ruñara huañushcaunamanda causachica .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Huañushca runauna causarinara uyasha , huaquinguna burlanauca ; shujguna ninauca : Caimanda canda uyashun cutillara .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo paigunajmanda llucshica .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Huaquinguna quirinauca . Pablohua llutarinauca . Chigunamanda Dionisio nishca Areópago runa aca , shu Dámaris nishca huarmindi , shujgunandi .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Caimanda huasha Pablo Atenasmanda llucshisha Corinto llactama rica .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Shu Pontomanda judio runara tupaca , paihua shuti Aquila , Italia llactamanda mushuj pactamuj , paihua huarmi Priscilandi . Claudio atun rey apu tucui judioguna Roma llactamanda llucshinauchu nisha mandaca . Pablo paigunahua llutarica .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Pablo paiguna tarabana samira yachaj asha , paigunahua causaca . Pariju tarabanauca , carpa huasira rajguna aca .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Tucui samana punzhaunai tandarina huasii judiogunahua griegounahua rimananauca .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Silas Timoteo Macedoniamanda shamushcai , Pablo entero munaihua Diospa shimira camachiuca , judiogunara yachachisha : Cai Jesús cierto Cristomi nisha .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Judioguna uyanara mana munanauca , Diosta camisha caparinauca . Chiraigumanda Pablo paihua churanara chausisha nica : Canguna yahuar canguna uma ahuai tiachu ; ñuca ima causaras mana charinichu . Cunamanda gentilgunajma risha .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Chimanda llucshisha Justo nishca runa huasima rica , cai Justo Diosta llaquij aca . Paihua huasi judioguna tandarina huasi rayai tiaca .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Crispo nishca , judioguna tandarina huasi apu , paihua aillundi Jesuspi quirinauca . Shinallara Corinto llactamanda ashcauna uyasha quirinauca , bautisarinauca .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Shinajpi Dios Pablora nuspaibi rimaca : Ama manzhaichu , nisha . Rimailla , ama chunllayaichu .

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: Astaunga ñuca canhua tiauni . Pihuas canda mana huajlichíngachu . Cai llactai ñucara quiringaraujgunara ashcara charini .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Chihui unaiyaca shu huata socta quüla tupura , Diospa shimira paigunara yachachisha .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Galión nishca Acaya partimanda apu ajpi , judioguna atarisha gun tandarinauca . Pablora apisha apu ñaupajma pushanauca .

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: Paiguna ninauca : Cai runa ñucanchi ley shimi mana rimashcasna runaunara yachachiun Diosta alabangaj .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Pablo rimai callarijpi , Galión judiogunara cutipasha nica : Ima manali rashca ajpi , ima atun causa ajpis cangunara uyaima , Judioguna , ley shimii rimashcasna .

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: Randi shimiunamanda , shutiunamanda , canguna ley shimimanda ashaga , canguna yachanguichi ; cai sami taripanara mana munanichu .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Paigunara paihua ñaupajmanda cachaca ,

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Shinajpi tucui griegouna Sostenes nishca judioguna tandarina huasimanda apura apisha , paita Galiomba ñaupjapi macanauca . Pai randi mana imais satiricachu .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Astaumbas Pablo chihui unai punzhaunara tiashca huasha , uquiunamanda dispirisha , Siria partima chimbacami . Paihua pariju Príscilandi Aquilandi rinauca . Cencreas nishca llactai , Diosma shimira cushcara ricuchingaj paihua umara rutuca .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Efeso llactama pactasha , Aquilaras Priscilaras chihui saquica . Paiga judioguna tandarina huasii icusha judiogunahua rimananauca .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Efeso runauna paita ruganauca unaira paigunahua tiangaj , randi mana munacachu .

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: Pablo paigunamanda dispirisha nica : Ursamanda ministirinmi ñuca Jerusalenma pactangaj shamuj istara huacachingaj . Huashaga Dios munajpi tigramushami . Casna rimasha Efesomanda barcoi rícami .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Cesareama pactasha , Jerusalenma sicaca quirijgunara salurangaj . Chimanda huasha Antioquíama rica . 23 Chihui unaira tiashca huasha llucshica . Galacia Frigia partiunara purisha , caran llactai tucui quirijgunara cariyachica .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Chi horasgunai shu Apolos nishca judio runa Efesoma pactamuca . Pai Alejandría nishca llactamanda shamuj , ali cuentayuj runa , Diospa shimira rimana ushaj aca .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Cai runaga Señorba ñambii yachachishca aca . Shinzhi espirituyuj asha Señorba shimiunara rimasha ali yachachica . Shinajllaira Juan bautisana samillara yachaca .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Pai mana ansas manzhasha judioguna tandarina huasii rimangaj callarica . Priscila Aquilandi uyasha , paita sapallai cayasha Diospa nambira astaun alira yachachinauca .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Pai Acaya partima pasasha nijpi , uquiuna paita animachinauca ringaj , quirijgunama quillcanauca paita apingaj . Chihui pactasha , quirijgunara ashcara yanapaca , paiguna Diospa gracia ali iyaimanda quirijguna asha .

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Paiga ashca ushaihua runauna ñaupajpi judioguna pandarishcara ricuchica . Quillcashcaunamanda ricuchisha , Cai Jesús quiquin Cristomi , nica .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Apolos chara Corintoi tiaushcai , Pablo urcu partii purishca huasha , Efeso llactama shamuca . Chihui huaquin quirijgunara tupaca .

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Paigunara tapuca : ¿ Canguna quirishcai Santo Espiritura apicanguichichu ? Paiguna cutipanauca : Santo Espíritu tiashcara mana ansallas uyashcanchichu .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo nica : ¿ Imaira bautisashcauna anguichi ? Paiguna cutipanauca : Juan bautisashcai , nisha .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Pablo nica : Juan arrepentirijgunara bautisaca , runaunara yachachisha paimanda huasha shamuj Jesuspi quirinauchu nisha ; pai Cristomi .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Caita uyasha , Señor Jesuspa shutii bautisarinauca .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Pablo paiguna ahuai paihua maquira churajpi , Santo Espíritu paiguna ahuai shamuca . Paiguna shu shimiunara rimanauca , shinallara Diosmanda rimanauca .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Cai runauna chunga ishqui tupu anauca .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Pablo judioguna tandarina huasii icusha , quinsa quilla tupura mana ansas manzhasha Dios mandana pacha shimira yachachica , runaunahua rimananausha .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Astaun huaquinguna shinzhiyasha , mana quirisha , tandarishca runauna ñaupajpi Jesuspa Ñambi nishcara manali rimanauca . Pablo paigunajmanda anzhurisha , quirijgunara chicanyachica . Caran punzha shu Tiranno nishca runa escuela huasii yachachica .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Shina rasha ishqui huata tupura catica . Shinajpi tucui Asia partii causajguna , judio ashas griego ashas , Señor Jesuspa shimira uyanauca .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Dios yapa munanaita rashcaunara Pablo maquihua rarca .

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo aichai pichashca pañelounara churanaunaras ungushcaunama apanauca . Shina rasha ungushcauna aliyanauca , paigunamanda irus supaiguna llucshinauca .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Huaquin yanga purij judioguna , supaigunara ichujguna tianauca . Señor Jesuspa shutira rimashun ninauca supai apishca runaunara alichíngaj . Supaigunama : Pablo rimaushca Jesuspa shutii llucshi , ninauca .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: Shu Sceva nishca runa , judioguna sacerdote apu , canzhis churiyuj aca . Caiguna casna ranauca .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Manali supai cutipasha nica : Jesusta ricsini , yachanimi pitairi Pablo . Cangunaga , ¿ pita anguichiri ?

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Supai apishca runa paiguna ahuai saltasha , paigunara vencica . Shinajpi paiguna chi huasimanda llatanguna chugrichishcauna miticunauca .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Tucui Efeso llactai causajguna uyanauca , judio ashas griego ashas . Tucui manzharinauca , shmarasha Señor Jesuspa shutira ahuayachishca aca .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Quirijgunamanda ashcauna shamunauca , paiguna ñaupa rashcaunara cuentasha ricuchinauca .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Shinallara ashca sagrana yachajguna paiguna yachaushca quillcaunara apamusha tucuihua ñaupajpi rupachinauca . Quillcauna valishcara yupasha ricujpi pichca chunga huaranga cullquiuna aca .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Shinami Diospa shimi mirarisha rica , ushaihua vencica .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Cai tucui pasashca huasha , Pablo paihua almai iyarica Jerusalenma ringaj , ^ Macedonia Acaya partiunara puríshca huasha . Pai nica : Ñuca Jerusalembi tiashca huasha ministirinmi shinallara Roma llactara ricungaj .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Pablo paita yanapajgunamanda ishquira , Timoteo Erasto nishcandi , Macedonia partima cachaca . Pai randi Asía llactai unaira saquiríca .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Chi horasgunai Jesuspa Nambira rimashcamanda runauna ashcara nusparisha pinarinauca .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Shu Demetrio nishca cullquira tarabaj runa ichilla huasiunara rarca , Diana nishca huarmi diospa alabana huasi cuenta ricurij . Shina tarabajgunama ashcara ganachij aca .

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Caigunama , shina tarabajgunamas , Demetrio nica : Runauna , canguna ali yachanguichi imasna cai ganashcamanda charij anchi .

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Canguna ricunguichi shinallara uyaunguichi imasna cai Pablo mana Efeso llactallai rimaun astaun ñaca tucui Asia partii . Ashca runaunara rimasha anzhuchishcarni , casna nisha , Maquihua rashca diosguna mana cierto diosgunachu .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Manzhai tianmi ñucanchi ganana pishii urmangami , shinallara atun Diana huarmi diospa templo huasi mana ansas llaquishca tucunga ; maspas tucui Asiai entero mundui llaquishca huarmi diospa sumajta huajlichingaj callaringa .

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Caita uyasha ashcara piñarinauca , casna nisha caparinauca : Efesiosguna Dianaga atunmi .

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Entero llacta nusparica . Tucui pariju paiguna tandarina huasima gun callpasha rinauca . Macedoniamanda Gayora Aristarcora , Pablora compañajgunara apinauca .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: Pablo runaunajma icusha nijpi , quirijguna mana munanauca .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Shinallara huaquin Asia partimanda apuuna , paihua amigouna asha , shimira Pabloma cachanauca pai tandarina huasima ama icui richu , nisha .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Shujguna shu samira caparinauca , chishujguna shujta . Tandarijguna nusparishca anauca . Mana yachanaucachu paiguna tandarishcara .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Runauna chaupi shungumanda shu Alejandro nishca runara judioguna llucchisha shayachinauca . Shinajpi Alejandro chunllayangaj maquihua ricuchica , runaunahua rimasha nisha .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Paita judio ajta ricsisha , tucui runauna ishqui horas tupura pariju caparinauca : Diana , Efesiosguna huarmi dios atunmi , nisha .

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Shinajpi quülcaj apu runaunara chunllayachisha rimaca : Efeso runauna , tucui runauna yachan imasna Efeso llactami Diana atun huarmi diospa huasira Jupitermanda urmamujtas cuiraj .

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Caita mana cutipaihuaj asha , canguna chunllayana ministirin , mana imaras dsas rasha .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Cai canguna pushamushca runaunaga camba huarmi diospa huasimanda mana shuhuanaushcachu , paihua shutiras mana caminaushcachu .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Demetrioga paihua pariju tarabajgunandi ima piñanaunaras charisha , taripana tian , taripajgunas tianaun . Parijumanda taripanuichi .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Maspas ima taripanaras charijpi , gobierno tandarinai aüchina usharin .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Manzhanami ñucanchillara causayachi tucungaj , cai tandarinara yangamanda tandarishcaraigu .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
text2: Caita rimashca huasha tandarijgunara dispirisha cachacami .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Llacta nusparishca chunllayajpi , Pablo quirijgunara cayasha paigunara cariyachica . Ujllarisha Pablo paigunara dispirica ; Macedonia partima ringaj llucshica .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: Cai partiunai purishca huasha , quirijgunara ashca rimashcahua cariyachishca huasha , Grecia partima pactamuca .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: Chihui quinsa quilla tiashca huasha , Siria partima chimbasha nica . Pai llucshiushcai judioguna paita huañuchinara munanauca . Chiraigumanda Macedonia partima tigranara iyarica .
column6: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
column8: ! Chiraigumanda chapaichi , iyarisha imasna ñuca quinsa huatara tutandi punzhandi caran dueñora camachinara mana saquicanichu , huacashcahua camachisha .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: Chihui quinsa quilla tiashca huasha , Siria partima chimbasha nica . Pai llucshiushcai judioguna paita huañuchinara munanauca . Chiraigumanda Macedonia partima tigranara iyarica .
column6: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
column8: ! Chiraigumanda chapaichi , iyarisha imasna ñuca quinsa huatara tutandi punzhandi caran dueñora camachinara mana saquicanichu , huacashcahua camachisha .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Cai runauna Pablora compañanauca Asiagama : Bereamanda Sopater , Tesalonicamanda Aristarco Segundo nishcandi , Derbemanda Gayo Timoteondi , Asiamanda Tíquico Trófimo nishcaunandi .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Caiguna ñaupasha , Troas nishca llactai ñucanchira chapanauca .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Pascua ista pasashca huasha , Filiposmanda chimbacanchi , Troas llactama . Pichca punzha huasha paigunahua tandaricanchi Troaspi . Chihui saquiricanchi canzhis punzhara .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Semana ñaupa punda punzhai quirijguna tandara paquingaj tandarinauca . Pablo paigunara camachica , cayandi punzha ringarausha . Pai rimaushcara chaupi tutagama yalichica .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Ahua patai paiguna tandariushcai ashca velara charinauca .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Shu Eutico nishca malta ventana pungüi tiauca . Pablo unaira rimajpi , Eutico huañujta puñusha , ahua patamanda allpama urmaca . Huanushcara atarichinauca .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Shinajpi , Pablo irgumusha cumurisha paita ujllarica , casna nisha : Ama manzharichichu , causaunmi .

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Sicamushca huasha , Pablo tandara paquicami , micucami ; chimanda huasha ashcara rimacami punzhayanagama . Shina rasha llucshica .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Chi maltara causajta apanauca ; chimanda ashcara cushiy anauca .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Ñucanchi ñaupasha barcoi ricanchi Asón llactama , chihui Pablora tupangaj . Pablo shina rangaj munaca , paiga chaquihua risha nica .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Pai Asón llactai ñucanchihua tandarijpi , paita barcoi apisha Mitilene nishca islama shamucanchi .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Chimanda barcoi purisha , shu punzha huasha Quío rayai shamucanchi . Cayandi punzha Samos nishca isla pungüi llutaricanchi . Trogilio nishca llactai llutarisha , cayandi punzha Mileto nishca llactama pactamucanchi .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: Pabloga Efeso llactara mana icusha pasasha nica , Asia partii ama unaiyangaj . Pai uctalla risha nica , usharijpi Pentecostés punzhai Jerusalembi tiangaj .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: Miletomanda Pablo Efesoma cachaca quirijgunamanda ricuj rucuuna shamungaj .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Paihuajma shamujpi , Pablo paigunara rimaca : Canguna yachanguichi imasna ñuca Asia partima shamushca punzhamanda pacha alira causashcani cangunahua .

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Diosta sirvicani manso shunguhua , ashca huacashcahua , ashca camashcaunahua , judioguna ñucara huañuchishun nishcamanda .

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Mana imaras pishiyashcani cangunama ali shimira rimangaj pajllais huasiunais .

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Judiogunama gentilgunamas Diospa ñaupajpi arrepentinara Señor Jesucristoi quirinaras ciertora rimashcani .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Cunaga Jerusalenma riuni , ñuca espiritui huatashca cuenta ani , mana yachasha imara tucuhuanga chihui .

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Astaun tucui llactaunai Santo Espíritu riman , ishcarinauna tormendarinaunas ñucara chapahuanaun , nisha .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Mana imaras casunichu ; ñuca causairas mana llaquinichu , usharijpi ñuca causaira cushihua tucuchisha , shinallara Señor Jesús ñucara cushca sirvinara , Dios llaquishcamanda evangelio shimira rimasha .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: Cunaga ñuca yachani imasna cangunahua Dios mandana pacha shimira rimasha pasashcani , cangunamanda mana pihuas ñuca ñahuira cuti ricuhuanguichu .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Chiraigumanda cangunara nini : Cuna punzha mana pimandas causayujchu ani .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Tucui Dios camachishca shimira mana pishiyasha cangunara rimashcani .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Shinajpi cangunapura ricuichi , shinallara quirijpuras , imasna Santo Espíritu paigunajpi cangunara churashcami ricuj rucuuna tucungaj , Señorba quiquin yahuarhua randishca iglesiara carangaj .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Ñuca yachani , imasna ñuca rishca huasha , canguna chaupi shungüi müli puma cuenta huajlichij runauna shamunaunga ; quirijgunara mana saquinaungachu .

text: Also of your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away disciples after them .
text2: Cangunamandallara irusta rimaj runauna atarinaungami , quirijgunara : Catihuai , nisha aisangaj .

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: Cunaga , uquiuna , cangunara Diospa maquü paihua gracia ali iyai shimiis saquiuni . Paiga ushajmi cangunara shayachingaj , tucui chicanyachishcaunahua paihua herencia nishca cushcara cungaj .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Cullquiras curiras churanaras mana pihuajtas munashcanichu .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Astaumbas canguna yachanguichi imasna ñuca ñucahua pariju ajgunandi ñucanchi ministishca tupura cai quiquin maquiunahua tarabashcani .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Tucuibi cangunara yachachishcani casna tarabasha ministishcaunara yanapangaj , shinallara Señor Jesús rimashcara iyaríngaj , imasna nica : Apinamanda yali cuyana mas cushiyachin .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Caita rimashca huasha Pablo cungurisha Diosta mañaca tucui paigunandi .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Shinajpi paiguna ashcara huacanauca , Pablo cunga tullui ujllarisha muchanaucami .

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: Pai rimashcamanda ashcara üaquirinauca , pai : Ñuca ñahuira mana cutihuaj ricuhuanguichichu , nisha . Shinajpi barcogama paita compañanauca .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Paigunajmanda anzhuríshca huasha barcoi pitijta ricanchi Cos nishca islama . Cayandi punzha Rodas nishca islama pactamucanchi . Chimanda Patara nishca llactama ricanchi .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Shu Fenicia llactama riu barcora tupasha , icusha ricanchi .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Chipre nishca isla ricurishcai , lluqui maqui partima saquisha , Siria partima huamburicanchi , Tiro llactama pactacanchi . Barco paihua carga chihui llucchina aca .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Quirijgunara tupasha , chihui canzhis punzhara saquiricanchi . Paiguna Espiritumanda yachachishca asha Pablora rimanauca : Jerusalenma ama richu , nisha .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Chi punzhauna pactarishca huasha llucshicanchi . Tucui quirijguna compañahuanauca , huarmiunandi huahuaunandi , llactamanda pajllagama . Yacu patai cungurisha Diosta mañacanchi .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Parijumanda ujllarishca huasha , barcoi icucanchi . Paigunaga huasiunama tigranaucami .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Tiromanda purisha barcoi , Tolemaida nishca llactama pactamucanchi . Uquiunara salurasha paigunahua shu punzhara saquiricanchi .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Cayandi punzha , Pablo paihua compañajgunandi ricanchi , Cesareama shamucanchi . Diospa evangelio shimira rimaj Felipe huasii icucanchi . Paiga ñaupa horas canzhis ajllashcaunamanda shujmi . Paihua huasii tiacanchi .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Felipe chuscu huanra ushushiunara charica . Paiguna Diosmanda rimajguna aca .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Ñucanchi chihui unai punzhaunara tiaushcai , shu Agabo nishca Diosmanda rimaj Judeamanda shamuca .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Agabo ñucanchima shamusha , Pablo chumbillina carara apisha , chaquindi maquindi paillara huatarica . Casna rimaca : Santo Espíritu casna nin , Cai chumbillinayujta judioguna casnami huatanaunga Jerusalembi . Paita gentilguna maquü cunaungami .

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Caita uyasha ñucanchi chi llactai tiajgunandi Pablora rugacanchi ama ringaj Jerusalenma .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo cutipaca : ¿ Imara ranguichi huacasha , ñuca shungura llaquichisha ? Ñuca huatai tucungaj puruntu ani , shinallara Jerusalembi huañungaj Señor Jesuspa shutira llaquishcamanda .

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Pai uyanara mana munajpi , rimanara saquicanchi , nisha : Señor munashca tono rashca achu .

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Cai punzhauna huasha puruntushca huasha , Jerusalenma sicacanchi .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Huaquin Cesareamanda quirijguna ñucanchihua shamunauca . Shu Mnason nishca runara paigunahua pariju pushamunauca . Pai Chipremanda shamuj aca , shu rucu quirij runa . Paihua huasii tiana acanchi .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Jerusalenma pactai rijpi uquiuna cushihua ñucanchira apinauca .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Cayandi punzha Pablo icuca ñucanchihua pariju Jacob ora ricungaj . Tucui ricuj rucuuna tandarishcara tuparinauca .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Paigunara salurashca huasha , Pablo tucui Dios gentilgunahua rashcaunara pai sirvishcamanda shuj shujlla rimasha cuentaca .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Paiguna uyasha Diosta alabanauca : Riqui , uqui , nisha , imasnara ashca huaranga judioguna quirinaushca . Tucui paiguna ley mandashcara huacachinaun .

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: Astaun canmanda casna rimashcara uyanaushca . Can gentilgunahua tiaj judiogunara yachachiungui , ninaun , Moisés mandashcaunara saquingaj , churiunara ama circuncisionda rangaj , yachaira ama catingaj .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: Shinajpi , ¿ imara rana angai ? Cierto pacha runauna tandarimunaunga can shamushcami nishcara uyasha .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: Shinajpi casna rai , ñucanchi rimashcasna : Ñucanchipura chuscu runa tianaun , Diosma shimira cushcauna .

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: Caigunara canhua pariju apisha , Moisés rimashcasna armaichi . Paiguna ministishcara pagai can , paiguna ruturingaj . Can chasna rasha , tucui intindinaunga paiguna canmanda uyashca mana ciertochu . Shinallara yachanaunga cambas ley shimira pactachiungui .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: Randi gentilgunamanda quirijgunama ña quillcashcanchi cai samiunara ama uyanauchu , nisha , astaun runa rashca diosgunama sacrificioi ricuchishca aichara ama micunauchu , yahuardas , yahuaryuj aicharas ama micunauchu , shinallara shujgunahua ama tacarinauchu .

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo chi runaunara apica . Cayandi punzha paigunandi armasha , Diospa templo huasii icuca , paiguna armashca punzhauna pactarishcara rimangaj , caran dueño cuyashcara cungaj .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Chi canzhis punzha ña pactaringaraushcai , huaquin Asiamanda judioguna Pablora temploi ricusha , tucui runaunara nuspachinauca , Pablora apinauca .

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: Caparisha rimanauca : Israel runauna , yanapaichi . Cai runa tucui partii judiogunaras , ley shimiras , cai huasiras tucui runaunama contra riman . Maspas gentilgunara temploi icuchisha cai santo huasira huajlichica .

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Ñaupa horas Efesomanda Trófimo nishcara Pablohua pariju puriuta ricunauca . Pablo paita temploi icuchishcami nisha iyanauca .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Shinajpi entero llacta nusparicami , tucui runauna gun callpasha shamunauca . Pablora apisha , templomanda pajllama aisasha llucchinauca . Templo punguunara uctalla tapanauca .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Paiguna Pablora huañuchingaj mascanauca . Chi ratollaira soldarouna atun capitanma rimanauca : Entero Jerusalén llacta nusparishcami , nisha .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Atun capitán shu capitangunara soldarounandi pushasha , paigunajma callpamunauca . Runaunaga atun capitanda soldarounaras ricusha , Pablora macan ara saquinauca .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: Shinajpi atun capitán pactai risha , Pablora apisha , paita ishqui cadenahua huatangaj mandaca . Shina rasha tapuca , ¿ Pitairi ? ¿ Imara rarca ? nisha .

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Chihui tandarijgunamanda shujguna shu samira shujguna shu samira rimanauca . Capitanga imara cierto intindinara mana ushacachu paiguna caparishcaraigu . Pablora cuartelma apangaj cachaca .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Rumi ehacanama pactaushcai soldarouna Pablora huandusha apanauca , runauna nusparishcaraigumanda .

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: Paiguna huashai ashca runa caparimunauca : Huañuchu , nisha .

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Pablora cuartel nishca soldado huasi ucuma icuchingaj callarijpi , pai atun capitanda nica : ¿ Imaras canda rimanara ushanichu ? Capitanga nica : ¿ Griego shimira yachanguichu ?

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: Can , ¿ manzhu chi Egipto runa angui , ñaupa horas gobiernora piñasha , shu chuscu huaranga huañuchijgunara runa illashca partima pushacangui ?

text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo nica : Ñucaga cierto pacha judio runa mani , Tarso llactamanda . Cai Tarso shu Cilicia nishca parti atun llactami . Canda rugauni lugarda cuhuapai runaunama rimangaj .

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: Atun capitán lugarda cujpi , Pablo rumi chacanai shayarisha , runaunara maquihua ricuchica . Tucui chunllayajpi , Pablo hebreo shimii rimaca .

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: Pablo nica : Runauna , uquiuna , yayaunandi , ñucajmanda cangunama rimangaraushcara cuna uyaichi .

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: Runauna Pablo hebreo shimira rimajta uyasha , paiguna maspas chunllayanauca . Pai nica :

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: Ñuca cierto pacha judio runa maní . Cilicia partii tiaj Tarso llactai pagaricani . Randi cai llactai iñacani Gamalielba ñaupajpi yachasha . Ñucanchi yayauna ley shimii yachachishca acani , Diosta llaquij imasna anguichi tucui canguna cuna punzhai .

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Jesuspa Ñambi nishcai causajgunara huañuchingama caticachacani ; cari ajpis huarmi ajpis chonda cularbi ishcacani .

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: Sacerdote atun apu shinallara tucui rucuunas caita ali yachanaun . Paigunamanda quillcaunara uquiunama apasha Damasco llactama ricani , chi llactamanda ajgunara Jerusalenma causayachisha pushangaj , paigunara livachingaj .

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: Ñuca Dasmascoma riushcai , pactana mayambi , chaupi punzha tupui , cungaimanda ahua pachamanda ashca punzhajlla ricurica ñuca muyujta .

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Allpama urmacani , shu shimira rimajta uyacani : Saulo , Saulo , nisha , ¿ imamanda tormendachihuangui ?

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: Shinajpi cutipacani : ¿ Pitanguiri , Señor ? Pai ñucara nica : Ñuca Nazaretmanda Jesús mani , can tormendachiushca .

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Ñucahua tiajguna punzhayashcara cierto pacha ricunaucami , caita ricusha manzharinaucami . Randi ñucara rimaj shimira mana intindinaucachu .

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: Ñuca nicani : ¿ Imara rashai , Señor ? Pai cutipasha nica : Atari , Damascoma ri . Chihui tucui can rangaj mandashcara canda rimashca anga .

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: Ñuca ricunara mana ushacanichu cai sumaj punzhayashcara ricushcamanda . Ñucahua tiajguna Damascoma maquimanda apisha pushahuanauca .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: Shinajpi shu Ananías nishca runa , ley shimira pactachij , tucui chihui tiaj judiogunamanda ali rimashca ,

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: ñucama shamusha llutarisha rimahuaca : Saulo , uqui , ricuj tucuchu , nica . Chi ratollai ñuca ñahui pascarica , paita ricucani .

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: Pai nica : Ñucanchi yayauna Dios canda ajliashcami pai munashca tonora ricsingaj , Ali Ajta ricungaj , pai rimashca shimiras uyangaj .

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Can cierto ricushcara paihua rimaj tucuna angui , tucui runaunama can ricushcaras uyashcaras cuentangaj .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Shinajpi cuna , ¿ imarasha chapaungui ? Atari , bautisari , canducha rashcara maillai , Jesuspa shutira cayasha .

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: Ñuca Jerusalenma tigrashcai , temploi Diosta mañaushcai , nuspashca cuenta munanaita ricucani .

text: And saw him saying unto me , Make haste , and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
text2: Ñucara rimajta ricucani : Uctalla ri , nica , Jerusalenmanda llucshi , nica ; can ñucamanda rimashcara mana uyanaungachu .

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: Ñuca nicani : Señor , paiguna yachanaun ñuca chonda cularbi ishcachij acani . Tucui judioguna tandarina huasiunai canda quirijgunara azutij acani ;

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: camba cierto rimaj Estébanba yahuar talirishca horas , ñucas chihui acani ; pai huañunara munacani ; paita huañuchijguna churanara huacachij acani .

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: Señorga rimahuaca : Ri , nisha canda caruma cachasha gentilgunama .

text: And they gave him audience unto this word , and then lifted up their voices , and said , Away with such a fellow from the earth : for it is not fit that he should live .
text2: Cai shimigama Pablora uyanauca . Shinajpi caparisha ninauca : Cai pachamanda casna runara anzhuchi . Pai causangaj mana valinzhu .

text: And as they cried out , and cast off their clothes , and threw dust into the air ,
text2: Paiguna caparisha churanaunara lliquisha allpa polvora ahuama shitanauca .

text: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle , and bade that he should be examined by scourging ; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him .
text2: Atun capitán Pablora cuartel ucui icuchingaj mandaca . Paita azutisha tapungaj mandaca , yachangaj imamanda runauna paimanda casna caparinauca .

text: And as they bound him with thongs , Paul said unto the centurion that stood by , Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman , and uncondemned ?
text2: Pablora cara huascahua huatanauca . Paiga chihui tiaj capitanda nica : ¿ Usharingachu shu romano runara azutingaj manara causayachijllaira ?

text: When the centurion heard that , he went and told the chief captain , saying , Take heed what thou doest : for this man is a Roman .
text2: Chi capitán Pablo rimashcara uyasha rimai rica atun capitanma , casna nisha : ¿ Imara rangaraungui ? Cai runa romano runami .

text: Then the chief captain came , and said unto him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said , Yea .
text2: Atun capitán Pabloma shamusha paita tapuca : Rimahuai , nica , ¿ ciertochu can romano runa angui ? Pablo : Ari , nica .

text: And the chief captain answered , With a great sum obtained I this freedom . And Paul said , But I was free born .
text2: Atun capitán nica : Ñucaga romano runa tucungaj ashca cullquira pagacani . Shinajpi Pablo nica : Ñuca randi pagarishcamanda pacha romano runa mani .

text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him : and the chief captain also was afraid , after he knew that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
text2: Shinajpi chi ratollai paita tormendachijguna anzhurinauca . Atun capitambas manzhacami Pablo romano runa ajta uyasha , paita huatashcamanda .

text: On the morrow , because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews , he loosed him from his bands , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear , and brought Paul down , and set him before them .
text2: Cayandi punzha ciertora yachanara munaca imamanda judioguna Pablora causayachinauca , sacerdote apuunara cayachi cachaca tucui paiguna gobiernoi mandaj runaunandi . Pablora llucchisha paiguna ñaupajpi ricuchica .

text: And Paul , earnestly beholding the council , said , Men and brethren , I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo gobiernoi mandaj runaunara ricusha , shina nica : Runauna , uquiuna , ñuca ali pacha Diospa ñaupajpi causashcani cuna punzhagama .

text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
text2: Sacerdote atun apu , Ananías , paihua rayai tiajgunara mandaca Pablora shimii sajmangaj .

text: Then said Paul unto him , God shall smite thee , thou whited wall : for sittest thou to judge me after the law , and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law ?
text2: Shinajpi Pablo nica : Dios canda sajmanga , ishqui shimiyujta . ¿ Ley shimimanda ñucara taripangaj caibi tiaungui , randi ley shimira mana pactachisha sajmachihuangui ?

text: And they that stood by said , Revilest thou God ' s high priest ?
text2: Chihui tiajguna ninauca : ¿ Shina rimashachu sacerdote atun apura camingui ?

text: Then said Paul , I wist not , brethren , that he was the high priest : for it is written , Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people .
text2: Pablo nica : Uquiuna , pai sacerdote atun apu ajta mana yachacanichu . Quillcashca tianmi : Runauna atun apura ama caminguichu .

text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , Men and brethren , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee : of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo ricusha riparaca shu parti runauna saduceoguna anauca , shu partiga fariseoguna anauca . Paiguna ñaupajpi caparica : Runauna , uquiuna , ñuca fariseo mani , fariseomanda churi ani . Ñucanchi chapaushcara huañushcaunamanda causarinaras taripai tucuni .

text: And when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided .
text2: Pablo caita rimajpi fariseoguna saduceogunahua piñarinauca . Tandarishcauna chaupirinauca .

text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit : but the Pharisees confess both .
text2: Saduceoguna huañushcamanda causarinas angelgunas supaigunas imas illan , ninaun . Randi fariseoguna cai tucui tianmi ninaun .

text: And there arose a great cry : and the scribes that were of the Pharisees ' part arose , and strove , saying , We find no evil in this man : but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him , let us not fight against God .
text2: Ashcara caparinauca . Fariseoguna partimanda yachaira yachachijguna atarisha rimanauca . Cai Pablo ima manali rashcaras mana tupanchichu , nisha . Ima espíritu , ima ángel paihua rimashca ajpi , Diosta ama arcachishunchi .

text: And when there arose a great dissension , the chief captain , fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them , commanded the soldiers to go down , and to take him by force from among them , and to bring him into the castle .
text2: Paigunapura ashcara piñarinauca . Atun capitán Pablora tsuntsura huactanaungami nisha , soldarounara cayachi cachaca Pablora paiguna chaupimanda dsas llucchingaj , cuartelma pushangaj .

text: And the night following the Lord stood by him , and said , Be of good cheer , Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem , so must thou bear witness also at Rome .
text2: Cayandi tuta Jesús Pabloma ricurimuca : Pablo , nica , cariyai , ama manzhaichu . Imasnara Jerusalembi ñuca shutira rimashcangui , shinallara Roma llactais ñuca shutira rimana angui .

text: And when it was day , certain of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul .
text2: Punzhayashca huasha huaquin judioguna Pablora huañuchingaj iyarinauca . Ama micushun , ama upishun Pablora huañuchingagama , Diospa shutii rimasha ninauca .

text: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy .
text2: Chuscu chunga yali casna rimajguna anauca .

text: And they came to the chief priests and elders , and said , We have bound ourselves under a great curse , that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul .
text2: Chiguna sacerdote apuunama rucuunamas rinauca , nisha : Ñucanchi Diospa shutii rimashcanchi ama micungaj Pablora huañuchinagama .

text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow , as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him : and we , or ever he come near , are ready to kill him .
text2: Cunaga canguna gobiernoi mandaj runaunandi atun capitanda rimanguichi , Pablora caya apamunauchu , canguna paimanda imaras yachana munanchi , nisha . Ñucanchiga pai manara pactamujllaira huañuchingaj chapariashun .

text: And when Paul ' s sister ' s son heard of their lying in wait , he went and entered into the castle , and told Paul .
text2: Shinajpi shu Pablo panimanda huahua paiguna casna rimashcara uyasha cuartelbi icuca Pablora cuentangaj .

text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him , and said , Bring this young man unto the chief captain : for he hath a certain thing to tell him .
text2: Pablo shu capitanda cayasha rimaca : Cai maltara atun capitanma pushai , nica . Shu shimira paita rimangaj charin .

text: So he took him , and brought him to the chief captain , and said , Paul the prisoner called me unto him , and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee , who hath something to say unto thee .
text2: Shinajpi paita atun capitanma pushasha , nica : Chonda cularbi ishcariai Pablo ñucara cayasha rugahuaca cai maltara canma pushai nisha . Imaras charin canda rimanara .

text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand , and went with him aside privately , and asked him , What is that thou hast to tell me ?
text2: Atun capitánga maltara maquimanda apisha shujma anzhurisha tapuca : ¿ Imara rimasha ningui ?

text: And he said , The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council , as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly .
text2: Chi malta nica : Judioguna iyarinaushca canda rugangaj Pablora caya gobierno huasima cachangaj paimanda imaras mas ciertora yachangaj .

text: But do not thou yield unto them : for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men , which have bound themselves with an oath , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and now are they ready , looking for a promise from thee .
text2: Astaumbas , canga ama quiringuichu , ama uyanguichu . Paigunamanda chuscu chunga yali Diospa shutii rimasha : Ama micushun ama upishun ninauca Pablora huañuchinagama . Cunaga can shimi cushcara puruntu chaparinaun .

text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart , and charged him , See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me .
text2: Shinajpi atun capitán maltara dispirisha nica : Can ñucara cuentashcara ama pimas rimanguichu .

text: And he called unto him two centurions , saying , Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea , and horsemen threescore and ten , and spearmen two hundred , at the third hour of the night ;
text2: Atun capitánga ishqui capitangunara cayasha nica : Las nueve tupura tuta , ishqui patsac soldarounaras , canzhis chunga caballoi purijgunaras , ishqui patsac lanzayujgunaras puruntushcara charínguichi , Cesareama ringaj .

text: And provide them beasts , that they may set Paul on , and bring him safe unto Felix the governor .
text2: Shinallara caballounara alichingaj mandaca Pablo montangaj , Félix nishca atun gobernadorhuajma ali pactangaj .

text: And he wrote a letter after this manner :
text2: Casna nisha , shu quillcara quillcacami :

text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting .
text2: Ñuca , Claudio Lysias nishca , canda Félix ali atun gobernadorda salurauni .

text: This man was taken of the Jews , and should have been killed of them : then came I with an army , and rescued him , having understood that he was a Roman .
text2: Cai runara , judioguna apishcara , paiguna huañuchingaraushcara , ñuca soldarounandi quishpichingaj ricani , pai romano runa ajta uyasha .

text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him , I brought him forth into their council :
text2: Imamandara paita causayachinaun nisha yachangaj , paita paiguna gobierno huasima pushacani .

text: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Chihui yachacani paiguna ley camachishca shimiunamanda paita causayachinauca . Ishcangaj huañuchingaj mana ima causaras charícachu .

text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man , I sent straightway to thee , and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him . Farewell .
text2: Judioguna cai runara huañuchingaraushcara rimahuanauca . Shinajpi uctalla paita canma cachamucani . Causayachijgunaras camba ñaupajpi rimanauchu nicani , paimanda ima causaras charisha . Alilla tiangui .

text: Then the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took Paul , and brought him by night to Antipatris .
text2: Soldarouna capitán mandashcasna Pablora tuta pushanauca Antipatris nishca llactagama .

text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
text2: Cayandi punzha caballoyuj soldarouna saquirinauca Pablohua ringaj . Chishujguna tigranauca paiguna cuartelma .

text: Who , when they came to Caesarea , and delivered the epistle to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
text2: Cesareama pactashcai quillcara atun gobernadorma cunauca , shinallara Pablora paihua ñaupajma ricuchinauca .

text: And when the governor had read the letter , he asked of what province he was . And when he understood that he was of Cilicia ;
text2: Atun gobernador quillcara ricusha tapuca : ¿ Ima partimandarairi ? Cilicia partimanda ajta yachasha ,

text: I will hear thee , said he , when thine accusers are also come . And he commanded him to be kept in Herod ' s judgment hall .
text2: Uyashcanguimi , nica , canda causayachijguna shamushcai . Herodespa huasima Pablora huacachingaj cachaca .

text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders , and with a certain orator named Tertullus , who informed the governor against Paul .
text2: Pichca punzha huasha , sacerdote atun apu , Ananías nishca , huaquin rucuunandi , shu Tértulo nishca ali cuentayuj runandi , Pablora causayachingaj atun gobernador ñaupajma shamunauca .

text: And when he was called forth , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness , and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence ,
text2: Pablora cayashca huasha , Tértulo paita causayachingaj callarica , nisha : Canmanda imasnara ali ganashua causaunchi , tucui ali tucun cai llactai can alira rashcamanda ,

text: We accept it always , and in all places , most noble Felix , with all thankfulness .
text2: Ali Félix , imahoraspas maibis cai tucuira agrasisha chasquinchi .

text: Notwithstanding , that I be not further tedious unto thee , I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words .
text2: Shinajpi canda ama yapa molestangaj camba ali shunguhua shu ratolla uyahuapai .

text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes :
text2: Cai runa yapa tormendachin , tucui judiogunara macanuchin cai pacha tucui partiunai . Astaumbas pai Nazaretmandauna monton apumi .

text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple : whom we took , and would have judged according to our law .
text2: Shinallara Diospa templo huasira huajlichinara munaca . Paita apisha , ñucanchi ley mandashca tonoi taripanara munacanchi .

text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us , and with great violence took him away out of our hands ,
text2: Randi cai Lisias nishca atun capitán satirisha , ashca ursahua Pablora ñucanchi maquimanda dsas quichuca .

text: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee : by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things , whereof we accuse him .
text2: Paita causayachijguna canma shamunauchu , nisha mandaca . Canllara paita taripasha tucui ñucanchi causayachishcaunara yachanara ushangui .

text: And the Jews also assented , saying that these things were so .
text2: Shinallara judioguna : Cai tucui ciertomi , nisha rimanauca .

text: Then Paul , after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , answered , Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation , I do the more cheerfully answer for myself :
text2: Shinajpi gobernador Pablora maquihua ricuchica rimangaj . Pablo cutipaca : Can cai llactai ashca huataunara taripaj ajpi , ali munaihua ñucamanda rimasha .

text: Because that thou mayest understand , that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship .
text2: Can yachanara ushangui chara chunga ishqui punzhallami Jerusalenma shamucani adorangaj .

text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man , neither raising up the people , neither in the synagogues , nor in the city :
text2: Ñucara mana tupahuanaucachu pihuas rimanauta , pi tandarishca runaunaras nuspachiuta , ima huasiunais ima llactais .

text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me .
text2: Shinallara paiguna ñucara cuna causayachishcaunara mana ushanaunzhu ricuchinara .

text: But this I confess unto thee , that after the way which they call heresy , so worship I the God of my fathers , believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets :
text2: Caita canda cierto rimani : Paiguna supai nishca Ñambira , Jesuspa nambira catisha , ñuca yayauna Diosta sirvini . Tucui ley shimira , tucui Diosmanda rimajguna camachishcaras quirisha causashcani .

text: And have hope toward God , which they themselves also allow , that there shall be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
text2: Diospi chapasha tiauni , paiguna chapashcasna , imasna huañushcauna causarinaungami , aliunas manaliunas .

text: And herein do I exercise myself , to have always a conscience void of offence toward God , and toward men .
text2: Chimanda ñuca tucui horas mascauni aü chuyaj iyaira charingaj Diospa ñaupajpi runauna ñaupajpis .

text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings .
text2: Huaquin huatauna pasashca huasha , ñuca llactama cullquira cuyangaj shamucani .

text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple , neither with multitude , nor with tumult .
text2: Ñuca casna raushcai , huaquin Asiamanda judioguna ñucara temploi armashcara tupahuanauca , mana ashca runaunahua , mana caparishcahua .

text: Who ought to have been here before thee , and object , if they had ought against me .
