text2: Chiguna camba ñaupajma shamunaunmaca ñucara causayachingaj , imaras ñucamanda rimanara charisha .

text: Or else let these same here say , if they have found any evil doing in me , while I stood before the council ,
text2: Mañajpi cáigunallara rimanauchu ima manalirara ñucajpi tupahuanauca ñuca gobierno ñaupajpi ricurishcai .

text: Except it be for this one voice , that I cried standing among them , Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day .
text2: Mañasha paiguna ñaupajpi shinzhira caparisha nicani : Huañushcauna causarinamanda cuna canguna taripahuashcanguichi .

text: And when Felix heard these things , having more perfect knowledge of that way , he deferred them , and said , When Lysias the chief captain shall come down , I will know the uttermost of your matter .
text2: Shinajpi Félix caí tucuira uyashca huasha , cai Ñambi nishcara ali yachasha , paigunara chapachica , nisha : Lisias nishca atun capitán shamushcai , canguna rimashcara uyasha .

text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul , and to let him have liberty , and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him .
text2: Gobernador capitanda rimaca Pablora huacachingaj , shinajllaira paita ansa lugarda cungaj . Maicans paihua amigounamanda shamujpi paita sirvingaj paita compañangaj , ama arcanguichu , nica .

text: And after certain days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , which was a Jewess , he sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
text2: Ansa punzha huasha , Félix paihua huarmi Drusilandi shamuca . Chi huarmi judio huarmi aca . Pablora cayasha , paimanda Jesucristoi quirina shimiunara uyanauca .

text: And as he reasoned of righteousness , temperance , and judgment to come Felix trembled , and answered , Go thy way for this time ; when I have a convenient season , I will call for thee .
text2: Pablo ali causanaras , aicha munaira arcarinaras , huasha taripanaras rimaca . Félix manzharisha nica : Cunad . Huasha lugarda charishcai cayashcangui .

text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul , that he might loose him : wherefore he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
text2: Shina rasha chapacami , Pablo cullquira cungami iyasha , paita cacharingaj . Caran cuti paita cayachi cachaj aca paihua rimangaj .

text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix ' room : and Felix , willing to shew the Jews a pleasure , left Paul bound .
text2: Astaun ishqui huata huasha Félix raigumanda Porcio Festo gobernador tucuca . Félixga judioguna llaquihuanauchu nisha , Pablora ishcariaita saquicami .

text: Now when Festus was come into the province , after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
text2: Festo cai partima pactamusha , quinsa punzha huasha Cesareamanda Jerusalenma rica .

text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul , and besought him ,
text2: Paima sacerdote apuuna valij judiogunandi shamunauca , Pablora causayachingaj ruganauca .

text: And desired favour against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem , laying wait in the way to kill him .
text2: Paiguna mañasha ruganauca Pablora Jerusalenma cachapai nisha , Pablora ñambii huañuchingaj .

text: But Festus answered , that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself would depart shortly thither .
text2: Astaun Festo cutipaca : Pablo ishcashca tiaun Cesárea llactai , chimallara ña ringarauni , nica .

text: Let them therefore , said he , which among you are able , go down with me , and accuse this man , if there be any wickedness in him .
text2: Cangunamanda ushajguna acuichi ñucahua pariju , nica . Paihuajpi ima causa tiajpi causayachichi .

text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days , he went down unto Caesarea ; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought .
text2: Festo Jerusalembi paigunahua pariju chapauca ansa punzhaunara , pusacchu chungachu ima chari . Chimanda huasha Cesareama shamusha , cayandi punzha gobierno huasii tiarica . Pablora pushangaj cachaca .

text: And when he was come , the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about , and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul , which they could not prove .
text2: Pablo shamujpi , Jerusalenmanda shamuj judioguna paita muyujta tandarinauca . Paita ashcara causayachinauca ; randi cierto ajta ricuchinara mana ushanaucachu .

text: While he answered for himself , Neither against the law of the Jews , neither against the temple , nor yet against Caesar , have I offended any thing at all .
text2: Astaumbas Pablo rimaca : Judioguna ley shimimandas templomandas Cesarba ñaupajpis mana ima ucharas rashcanichu .

text: But Festus , willing to do the Jews a pleasure , answered Paul , and said , Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ?
text2: Festoga astaun , judioguna llaquihuanauchu nisha , Pabloma nica : ¿ Jerusalenma rinara munanguichu chima ñuca ñaupajpi taripai tucungaj ?

text: Then said Paul , I stand at Caesar ' s judgment seat , where I ought to be judged : to the Jews have I done no wrong , as thou very well knowest .
text2: Pablo cutipaca : César nishca atun apu taripana huasü tiauni , caibi taripai tucuna mani . Judiogunara mana ima manaliras rashcanichu imasna canllara ali yachangui .

text: For if I be an offender , or have committed any thing worthy of death , I refuse not to die : but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me , no man may deliver me unto them . I appeal unto Caesar .
text2: Ñuca ima manaliras ima huañuna tupuras rashca asha , puruntu mani huañungaj . Astaun paiguna ñucara causayachishcauna mana cierto ajpi , pis mana ushanzhu ñucara paiguna maquii entregangaj . César taripahuachu , nini .

text: Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , Hast thou appealed unto Caesar ? unto Caesar shalt thou go .
text2: Festo gobiernoi mandajgunahua rimanausha cutipaca : Cesarma rinara munangui ? Cesarma riunguimi .

text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus .
text2: Ansa punzha pasashca huasha , Agripa nishca rey apu paihua huarmi Bernice nishcahua Cesareama shamunauca Festora salurangaj .

text: And when they had been there many days , Festus declared Paul ' s cause unto the king , saying , There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix :
text2: Paiguna ashca punzhaunara chihui tiaushcai , Festo rey apuma Pablora causayachishcara cuentaca , nisha : Félix shu runara ishcashcara saquica .

text: About whom , when I was at Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , desiring to have judgment against him .
text2: Ñuca Jerusalenma rishcai , sacerdote apuuna judioguna apuunandi ñucama shamunauca , ñucara mañasha paita causayachingaj .

text: To whom I answered , It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die , before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face , and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him .
text2: Paigunama cutipacani : Romanouna yachaibi pitas huañuchingaj mana cunachu manara causayachishca runa paita causayachijgunara rimachu paihua causamanda llushpiringaj .

text: Therefore , when they were come hither , without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat , and commanded the man to be brought forth .
text2: Shinajpi paiguna shamunaupi , mana unayasha , cayandi punzha taripana huasii tiarisha chi runara apamungaj cachacani .

text: Against whom when the accusers stood up , they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed :
text2: Paiguna ñuca ñaupajpi tiasha , mana ansas ñuca iyashcasna causayachinaucachu .

text: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition , and of one Jesus , which was dead , whom Paul affirmed to be alive .
text2: Astaun paiguna quirishcaunamanda paita causayachinauca , shinallara shu huañushca Jesús nishcamanda , astaun Pablo paimanda , Cierto pacha causaunmi , nica .

text: And because I doubted of such manner of questions , I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these matters .
text2: Ñuca cai samiunara mana yachasha , paita nicani : ¿ Jerusalenma rinara munanguichu chima taripai tucungaj ?

text: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus , I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar .
text2: Astaun Pablo Augusto César uyachu nisha mañaca ; paita huacachingaj mandacani Cesarma cachanagama .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus , I would also hear the man myself . To morrow , said he , thou shalt hear him .
text2: Shinajpi Agripa Festoma rimaca : Ñucas chi runara uyanara munani . Festo cutipaca : Caya punzha uyangui , nisha .

text: And on the morrow , when Agrippa was come , and Bernice , with great pomp , and was entered into the place of hearing , with the chief captains , and principal men of the city , at Festus ' commandment Paul was brought forth .
text2: Cayandi punzha Agripa Bernicehua shamunauca , sumaj churarishcauna . Taripana huasii icusha capitangunahua llactamanda valij runaunahua , Festo mandashca ajpi Pablora pushamunauca .

text: And Festus said , King Agrippa , and all men which are here present with us , ye see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me , both at Jerusalem , and also here , crying that he ought not to live any longer .
text2: Shinajpi Festo nica : Rey apu Agripa , tucui ñucanchihua pariju tiaj runaunas , cai runara ricuichi . Tucui judioguna Jerusalembi cai llactais cai runamanda rugahuanauca , ama mas causachu nisha caparisha .

text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death , and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus , I have determined to send him .
text2: Ñuca mana ima huañunaras tupacanichu paihuajpi . Paulara Augustoma riña munajpi , paita cachangaj iyaricani .

text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord . Wherefore I have brought him forth before you , and specially before thee , O king Agrippa , that , after examination had , I might have somewhat to write .
text2: Ñuca mana imaras ciertora charisha ñuca señorma quillcangaj , paita canguna ñaupajpi llucchicani , maspas camba ñaupajpi Rey Apu Agripa , paita tapushca huasha ñuca imaras charisha quillcangaj .

text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner , and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him .
text2: Mana valinzhu , yachin , shu causayuj runara cachangaj , pai causayashcara mana rimasha .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Thou art permitted to speak for thyself . Then Paul stretched forth the hand , and answered for himself :
text2: Shinajpi Agripa Pabloma rimaca : Cambajmandallara rimanara ushangui . Shinajpi Pablo maquira chutachisha , shina rimangaj callarica :

text: I think myself happy , king Agrippa , because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews :
text2: Cushi mani , Rey Apu Agripa , nica , cuna punzha camba ñaupajpi ñucajmanda rimangaj , tucui imamandas judioguna causayachihuanaun .

text: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews : wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently .
text2: Can tucui judioguna yachaira ali yachangui , shinallara paiguna iyarishca tonora . Chiraigumanda canda rugauni ali pacha uyahuapai .

text: My manner of life from my youth , which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem , know all the Jews ;
text2: Ñuca maltamanda pacha ñaupa pundamanda ñuca Jerusalén llactai causacani . Tucui judioguna ñuca causashcara yachanaun .

text: Which knew me from the beginning , if they would testify , that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
text2: Paiguna shinallara yachanaun , rimasha nijpi , imasnara ñaupa pundamanda pacha ñucanchi yachaira mas yali pactachisiqui montombi acani , fariseo acani .

text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers :
text2: Cunaga Dios ñucanchi yayaunama cushca shimimanda chapanaraigu causayachi tucuni .

text: Unto which promise our twelve tribes , instantly serving God day and night , hope to come . For which hope ' s sake , king Agrippa , I am accused of the Jews .
text2: Ñucanchi chunga ishqui ailluuna cai shimi pactachishcara ricungaj chapanaun , tutandi punzhandi Diosta sirvisha . Cai chapanaraigu , Rey Apu Agripa , judiogunamanda ñuca causayuj tucuni .

text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you , that God should raise the dead ?
text2: ¿ Imarasha cangunapura mana quirihuajta iyaringuichi Dios huañushcaunara causachingami ?

text: I verily thought with myself , that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Nucaga cierto pacha iyaricani imara ranas ministirica Nazaretmanda Jesuspa shutira huajlichingaj .

text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem : and many of the saints did I shut up in prison , having received authority from the chief priests ; and when they were put to death , I gave my voice against them .
text2: Jerusalembi shinallara rarcani , chonda cularbi ashca quirijgunara ishcacani , sacerdote apuuna ushaira cujpi ; imahoras huañuchinaupi ñuca alimi nicani .

text: And I punished them oft in every synagogue , and compelled them to blaspheme ; and being exceedingly mad against them , I persecuted them even unto strange cities .
text2: Ashca cuti paigunara livachicani tucui judioguna tandarina huasiunai . Paigunara Diospa shutira camichicani . Ashca loco tucusha paigunara caru llactaunagama caticani .

text: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
text2: Chasna raushcai Damascoma riucani ; sacerdote apuuna cachahuanauca paiguna mandashcahua .

text: At midday , O king , I saw in the way a light from heaven , above the brightness of the sun , shining round about me and them which journeyed with me .
text2: Chaupi punzha , ñambii riushcai , Rey Apu , indimanda yali punzhara ahua pachamanda shamujta ricucani . Ñucaras ñucahua pariju tiajgunaras muyujta ricurica .

text: And when we were all fallen to the earth , I heard a voice speaking unto me , and saying in the Hebrew tongue , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Tucui ñucanchi allpama urmacanchi . Shu shimira ñucara rimajta uyacani hebreo shimii : Saulo , Saulo , nisha ¿ imamanda tormendachihuangui ? Can tucsina pundai nijtasha canllara chugringui .

text: And I said , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest .
text2: Shinajpi nicani : ¿ Pitanguiri , Señor ? Señor Jesús cutipahuaca : Ñuca can tormendachiushca Jesús mani .

text: But rise , and stand upon thy feet : for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose , to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen , and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee ;
text2: Atari , nica , shayari . Chiraigumanda canma ricurimushcani , canda churashcani ñucara sirvij , ñucamanda rimaj tucungaj , can ricushcaunara rimangaj , shinallara canda huasha ñucamanda ricurímungaraushcaras cuentangaj .

text: Delivering thee from the people , and from the Gentiles , unto whom now I send thee ,
text2: Canda camba ailluunamandas gentilgunamandas quishpichisha , cuna paigunama canda cachauni ,

text: To open their eyes , and to turn them from darkness to light , and from the power of Satan unto God , that they may receive forgiveness of sins , and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me .
text2: paiguna ñahuira pascangaj , llandumanda punzhama turcaringaj , supai apu ushaimanda llushpirisha Diospi quiringaj , paiguna ñucara quirisha uchamanda perdonda apingaj , chicanyachishcaunahua Dios cushcara apingaj .

text: Whereupon , O king Agrippa , I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision :
text2: Chiraigumanda Rey Apu Agripa , ahua pachamanda ricuchishcara uyacani .

text: But shewed first unto them of Damascus , and at Jerusalem , and throughout all the coasts of Judaea , and then to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , and do works meet for repentance .
text2: Shinajpi ñaupa punda Damascoi , Jerusalembi , tucui Judea llactaunai , shinallara gentilgunamas rimacani arrepentirinauchu , Diospi quirinauchu , ali rashcaunahua paiguna arrepentirishcara ricuchisha .

text: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple , and went about to kill me .
text2: Caimanda judioguna apihuanauca temploi , huañuchingaj iyarihuanauca .

text: Having therefore obtained help of God , I continue unto this day , witnessing both to small and great , saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come :
text2: Dios yanapashcamanda cuna punzhagama rimasha catiuni ichillaunamas atungunamas . Imara Moisés Diosmanda rimajgunas rimashca tucungaraushcara , chillara yachachishcani :

text: That Christ should suffer , and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead , and should shew light unto the people , and to the Gentiles .
text2: imasnara Cristo tormendaringarauca , huañushcaunamanda ñaupa punda causarij tucungaj , causana shimira runaunamas gentilgunamas rimangaj .

text: And as he thus spake for himself , Festus said with a loud voice , Paul , thou art beside thyself ; much learning doth make thee mad .
text2: Pablo paimanda rimajpi , Festo shinzhira caparisha nica : Loco tucushcangui , Pablo . Can ashca yachashcamanda loco tucushcangui .

text: But he said , I am not mad , most noble Festus ; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness .
text2: Pablo nica : Yapa ali Festo , mana locochu ani . Astaumbas cierto shimiunara ali shimiunaras rimauni .

text: For the king knoweth of these things , before whom also I speak freely : for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him ; for this thing was not done in a corner .
text2: Rey apu caigunara ali yachan , chiraigumanda paihua ñaupajpi mana manzhasha rimauni . Ñuca iyani pai tucuira ali pacha yachan , mana pacallai rashcachu aca .

text: King Agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
text2: Rey Apu Agripa , ¿ Diospa shimira rimajgunara quiringuichu ? Can quiringuimi , yachani .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian .
text2: Shinajpi Agripa Pabloma rimaca : Ñacalla iyachihuangui ñucara shu cristiano nishca tucungaj .

text: And Paul said , I would to God , that not only thou , but also all that hear me this day , were both almost , and altogether such as I am , except these bonds .
text2: Pablo cutipaca : Dios munanma mana ñacalla astaun entero iyaihua ñucasna tucungaj , mana canlla astaun tucui ñucara uyajguna , randi mana cadenayuj .

text: And when he had thus spoken , the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and they that sat with them :
text2: Pablo cai tucuira rimashca huasha , rey apu , gobernador , Bernice , paigunahua pariju tiajgunandi atarinauca .

text: And when they were gone aside , they talked between themselves , saying , This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Paiguna shujma risha paigunapura rimananauca , nisha : Cai runa mana ima huañunaras , mana ima ishcarinaras charin .

text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus , This man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto Caesar .
text2: Agripa Festoma nica : Cai runa ushanmaca cachari tucungaj mana César taripahuachu nishca ajpi .

text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius , a centurion of Augustus ' band .
text2: Ñucanchi Italiama shu barcoi ringaj nishcai , Pablora shu causayujgunandi shu Julio nishca capitanma cunauca . Pai Augusta nishca soldaro monton capitán maca .

text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium , we launched , meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia ; one Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
text2: Shina rasha shu Adrumeto nishca llactama rij barcoi icucanchi ; Asia parti yacu punguunai llutarina aca . Aristarco , shu Tesalonicamanda Macedonia runa , ñucanchihua compañasha llucshicanchi .

text: And the next day we touched at Sidon . And Julius courteously entreated Paul , and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself .
text2: Cayandi punzha Sidonma pactacanchi . Julio , Pablora llaquisha , paita lugarda cuca paihua amigounajma ringaj , paiguna Pablora cuirangaj .

text: And when we had launched from thence , we sailed under Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
text2: Chimanda huamburisha Chipre islara huaira illashca partira pasacanchi , huaira shujpurama shinzhi aitajpi .

text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came to Myra , a city of Lycia .
text2: Cilicia Pamfilia partiunara mayanda pasacanchi . Licia partii tiaj Mira nishca llactama pactamucanchi .

text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy ; and he put us therein .
text2: Chihui ñucanchi capitán shu Alejandriamanda barcora tupaca , Italiama riuta . Chi barcoi ñucanchira icuchica .

text: And when we had sailed slowly many days , and scarce were come over against Cnidus , the wind not suffering us , we sailed under Crete , over against Salmone ;
text2: Ashca punzhauna alimanda huamburishca huasha , tormendoshua Cnido llacta ñahuipurai pactacanchi , huaira arcajpi . Shina rasha Creta islara huaira illashca partira pasacanchi Salmón llacta ñahuipurai .

text: And , hardly passing it , came unto a place which is called The fair havens ; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea .
text2: Ashca tormendoshua isla mayanlla huamburicanchi . Ali Punguuna nishcama pactacanchi , La sea llacta mayambi .

text: Now when much time was spent , and when sailing was now dangerous , because the fast was now already past , Paul admonished them ,
text2: Ashcara unaiyashcamanda , shinallara sasina punzhauna pasashcamanda , lamarbi huamburina ña huañuihuaj tucuca .

text: And said unto them , Sirs , I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage , not only of the lading and ship , but also of our lives .
text2: Pablo paigunara camachisha nica : Runauna , tormendoshua huamburishun , ashca pirdirinahuas ; mana cargallas barcollas pirdirinaungachu astaun shinallara ñucanchis .

text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship , more than those things which were spoken by Paul .
text2: Soldaro capitánga Pablo rimashcara mana quiricachu ; randi barco capitanda barcoyuj dueñoras uyaca .

text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in , the more part advised to depart thence also , if by any means they might attain to Phenice , and there to winter ; which is an haven of Crete , and lieth toward the south west and north west .
text2: Cai pungu mana valijpi tamia tiempora pasangaj , ashcauna chimanda llucshingaj iyarinauca , usharijpi Fenice punguma pactangaj , chihui tamiara pasangaj . Fenice shu Creta pungu aca , indi llucshimuna rayara ricurij .

text: And when the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , loosing thence , they sailed close by Crete .
text2: Huaira alilla sur nishca quinri partimanda aitamujpi , paiguna munashcami shamun nisha iyanauca . Barcora apichina iru garautora aisasha llucchisha , Creta isla yacu pata mayanda rinauca .

text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind , called Euroclydon .
text2: Mana ansahuara riushcai , Euróclidon nishca shinzhi huaira ali maqui partimanda aitasha , barcora apica .

text: And when the ship was caught , and could not bear up into the wind , we let her drive .
text2: Huaira barcora apajpi mana ushacanchichu paihua pundara huairapurama muyuchingaj ; shinajpi barcora saquicanchi huaira apashcama ringaj .

text: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda , we had much work to come by the boat :
text2: Ñucanchi shu ichilla islara , Clauda nishcara , ali maqui partima pasacanchi , chihui tormendoshua ichilla canoara apiñara ushacanchi .

text: Which when they had taken up , they used helps , undergirding the ship ; and , fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands , strake sail , and so were driven .
text2: Ichilla canoara barcoi icuchishca huasha , barcora huascaunahua shinzhira huatanauca ama paquiringaj . Sirte nishca partima pactai rinara manzhasha , huaira aitana llachapaunara irguchinauca barco huaira apashcama ringaj .

text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest , the next day they lightened the ship ;
text2: Astaumbas , cayandi punzha , huaira mas shinzhiyaca ; shina rasha cargara lamarma ichunauca barcora pangallay achingaj .

text: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship .
text2: Quinsa punzhai , ñucanchi quiquin maquiunahua barco charishcaunara ichungaj callaricanchi .

text: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared , and no small tempest lay on us , all hope that we should be saved was then taken away .
text2: Unaira indis estrellasgunas mana ricurijpi , huaira shinzhi atarijpi , mana chari causashun iyacanchi .

text: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them , and said , Sirs , ye should have hearkened unto me , and not have loosed from Crete , and to have gained this harm and loss .
text2: Shinajpi ñucanchi unaira mana micusha , Pablo paiguna chaupi shungüi shayarisha nica : Cierto pacha , runauna , ali anmaca ñucara uyangaj , ama llucshingaj Cretamanda , casna tormendarishcaras pirdirishcaras ama apingaj .

text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer : for there shall be no loss of any man ' s life among you , but of the ship .
text2: Astaun cuna rimauni : Cariyaichi . Shu runas mana chingaringachu , randi barcolla chingaringami .

text: For there stood by me this night the angel of God , whose I am , and whom I serve ,
text2: Cuna tuta , shu Diospa ángel ñucahua tiauca . Ñucas cai Diospaj ani , paita sirviuni .

text: Saying , Fear not , Paul ; thou must be brought before Caesar : and , lo , God hath given thee all them that sail with thee .
text2: Cai ángel rimasha nica : Pablo , ama manzhaichu . Can César ñaupajpi pactai riña angui . Dios tucui canhua pariju compañajgunaras canma cushcami .

text: Wherefore , sirs , be of good cheer : for I believe God , that it shall be even as it was told me .
text2: Chiraigumanda cushiyaichi , runauna . Ñucaga Diosta quirinimi . Pai rimashcasna pactaringami .

text: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island .
text2: Shu islai shitai tucuna anchi .

text: But when the fourteenth night was come , as we were driven up and down in Adria , about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country ;
text2: Chunga chuscu tuta tucushcai , Adriático nishca lamarbi huamburicanchi . Barcora apaicachajguna chaupi tuta horaspi allpa mayambi chari anchi nisha iyanauca .

text: And sounded , and found it twenty fathoms : and when they had gone a little further , they sounded again , and found it fifteen fathoms .
text2: Yacu tupuna huascara cacharisha , yacura tupunauca . Ishqui chunga rigra tupu ucu maca . Mas ñaupajma risha , cutillara huascara shitanauca . Chihui chunga pichca rigra tupu maca .

text: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks , they cast four anchors out of the stern , and wished for the day .
text2: Rumii tacarinamanda manzhasha , barco siquimanda chuscu apichina iru garautora cachanauca . Uctalla punzhayachu nisha chapanauca .

text: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship , when they had let down the boat into the sea , under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship ,
text2: Barcora apaicachajguna miticungaj ichilla canoara yacuma irguchinauca , pundamanda iru garautora cacharingaraujsna rasha .

text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , Except these abide in the ship , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Pablo capitanda soldarounaras rimaca : Caiguna mana barcoi saquirinaupi , canguna mana quishpinara usbanguichi .

text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
text2: Shinajpi soldarouna huascaunara pitisha canoara cacharinauca .

text: And while the day was coming on , Paul besought them all to take meat , saying , This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting , having taken nothing .
text2: Punzhayai callarijpi Pablo tucuira camachica : Canguna tucui micuichi , nisha . Cuna ña chunga chuscu punzhara yarcaihua chapashcanguichi , mana ansas micusha .

text: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat : for this is for your health : for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you .
text2: Chiraigumanda cangunara rugauni : Micuichi , canguna causaimanda . Canguna umamanda mana shu acchallas urmangachu .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he took bread , and gave thanks to God in presence of them all : and when he had broken it , he began to eat .
text2: Casna rimashca huasha , Pablo tandara apisha , tucuihua ñaupajpi Diosta agrasica , tandara paquisha micungaj callarica .

text: Then were they all of good cheer , and they also took some meat .
text2: Shinajpi tucui ña cushiyasha shinallara micunauca .

text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls .
text2: Tucui ñucanchi barcoi tiajguna ishqui patsac canzhis chunga soctapura acanchi .

text: And when they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , and cast out the wheat into the sea .
text2: Pactajta micushca huasha , barcora pangallayachinauca , apaushca trigora lamarma ichunauca .

text: And when it was day , they knew not the land : but they discovered a certain creek with a shore , into the which they were minded , if it were possible , to thrust in the ship .
text2: Na punzhayajpi , ricurij allpara mana ricsinaucachu . Shu pulayayuj lamar muyuira ricunauca . Chihui barcora llutachinara iyanauca , usharijpi .

text: And when they had taken up the anchors , they committed themselves unto the sea , and loosed the rudder bands , and hoised up the mainsail to the wind , and made toward shore .
text2: Huascaunara pitisha , garautounara lamarbi saquinauca . Carminara huatana huascaras cacharinauca . Barco pundai aj huaira aitana llachapara atarichinauca , pulayama llutaringaj .

text: And falling into a place where two seas met , they ran the ship aground ; and the forepart stuck fast , and remained unmoveable , but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves .
text2: Astaun ishqui yacupura aitariushcai , barco punda rumii siriricami . Barco siqui pascaringaj callarica , lamar tsaglas shinzhi aitashcaraigumanda .

text: And the soldiers ' counsel was to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim out , and escape .
text2: Shinajpi soldarla tucui cauiayujgunara huañuchingaj iyarinauca , ama pihuas huaitasha miticungaj .

text: But the centurion , willing to save Paul , kept them from their purpose ; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea , and get to land :
text2: Astaun capitán Pablora quishpichinara munasha , paiguna iyarishcara arcaca , nisha : Huaitanara ushajguna yacuma ñaupa saltaichi pulayama llucshingaj .

text: And the rest , some on boards , and some on broken pieces of the ship . And so it came to pass , that they escaped all safe to land .
text2: Chishujgunamanda huaquinguna palaunai huaquinguna ima barco paquiunais llutarisha , tucui pulayama llucshisha quishpinauca .

text: And when they were escaped , then they knew that the island was called Melita .
text2: Ña quishpishca huasha yachacanchi cai isla Malta nishca aca .

text: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness : for they kindled a fire , and received us every one , because of the present rain , and because of the cold .
text2: Chi isla runauna ñucanchira ali munaihua ricunauca . Ninara apichisha tucui ñucanchira cayanauca , ashca tamia ashcamanda , ñucanchi chirichishcamandas .

text: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks , and laid them on the fire , there came a viper out of the heat , and fastened on his hand .
text2: Shinajpi Pablo chaquishca hualista pallasha , ninai taucaca . Nina rupajmanda shu machacui llucshisha Pablo maquii pillurica .

text: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand , they said among themselves , No doubt this man is a murderer , whom , though he hath escaped the sea , yet vengeance suffereth not to live .
text2: Chi runauna Pablo maquii machacui huamburijta ricusha , paigunapura rimananauca : Ciertomi cai runa shu runara huañuchishca . Pai larmarmanda quishpijta Dios randi paita mana causaira cun .

text: And he shook off the beast into the fire , and felt no harm .
text2: Astaun Pablo machacuira ninai chausica ; imas mana tucucachu .

text: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen , or fallen down dead suddenly : but after they had looked a great while , and saw no harm come to him , they changed their minds , and said that he was a god .
text2: Shinajpi paiguna chapanauca ñalla maqui punguingami nisha , mañasha huañusha urmangami . Unaira chapashca huasha , mana imas tucujpi , shu tonoro iyarinauca : Paiga shu diosmi , nisha .

text: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island , whose name was Publius ; who received us , and lodged us three days courteously .
text2: Chi isla partii , islamanda apu allpauna tianauca . Paihua shuti Publio aca . Pai ñucanchira cayaca . Quinsa punzhara ñucanchira gusto cuirasha chanca .

text: And it came to pass , that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux : to whom Paul entered in , and prayed , and laid his hands on him , and healed him .
text2: Publio yaya calenturahua ungushca asha caitui siriuca , yahuardas ismasha huañuuca . Pablo paihuajma icuca , Diosta mañashca huasha ungushca ahuai maquira churasha paita alichica .

text: So when this was done , others also , which had diseases in the island , came , and were healed :
text2: Caita rashca huasha shinallara shujgunas islai tiaj ungushcaunas shamunauca , alichi tucunauca .

text: Who also honoured us with many honours ; and when we departed , they laded us with such things as were necessary .
text2: Chigunas ñucanchira llaquinauca , ashcara ñucanchima cuyanauca . Ñucanchi rijpis tucui ministishcaunaras cuyanauca .

text: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria , which had wintered in the isle , whose sign was Castor and Pollux .
text2: Shina rasha , quinsa quilla huasha , Alejandría llactamanda barcoi icucanchi , chi barco tamia tiempora islai pasaca . Barco shuti Castor Polux nishca aca .

text: And landing at Syracuse , we tarried there three days .
text2: Siracusa nishca llactama pactasha , quinsa punzhara chihui tiacanchi .

text: And from thence we fetched a compass , and came to Rhegium : and after one day the south wind blew , and we came the next day to Puteoli :
text2: Chimanda isla mayanda risha , Regio nishca llactama pactamucanchi . Shu punzha huasha , huaira huashamanda aitajpi , cayandi punzha Puteoli nishca llactama shamucanchi .

text: Where we found brethren , and were desired to tarry with them seven days : and so we went toward Rome .
text2: Chihui quirij uquiunara tupacanchi . Ñucanchira ruganauca paigunahua canzhis punzha tupura tiangaj . Chimanda huasha Roma llactama ricanchi .

text: And from thence , when the brethren heard of us , they came to meet us as far as Appiiforum , and The three taverns : whom when Paul saw , he thanked God , and took courage .
text2: Chimanda uquiuna ñucanchi shamushcara uyasha , ñucanchira tupangaj llucshimunauca . Apio catuna pulasagama Quinsa Samana Huasi nishca llactagamas shamunauca . Pablo paigunara ricusha Diosta agrasisha cariyaca .

text: And when we came to Rome , the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard : but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him .
text2: Roma llactama pactamushcai ñucanchi capitán causayujgunara soldaro atun capitanma entregaca . Randi Pablora lugarda cushca aca shujpi causangaj , shu soldaro cuirashcai tiangaj .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together : and when they were come together , he said unto them , Men and brethren , though I have committed nothing against the people , or customs of our fathers , yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans .
text2: Quinsa punzha huasha Pablo judioguna apuunara cayaca . Paiguna paihua pariju tandarijpi Pablo paigunara nica : Runauna , uquiuna , ñuca mana imaras rashcanichu judiogunaras ñucanchi yayauna yachairas huajlichingaj . Jerusalenmanda pacha causayachishca shamushcani Romanosguna maquii cushca .

text: Who , when they had examined me , would have let me go , because there was no cause of death in me .
text2: Paiguna ñucara taripashca huasha cacharinara munanauca , mana ima huañuna causas tiajpi .

text: But when the Jews spake against it , I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar ; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of .
text2: Astaun judioguna inquitanauca , chiraigumanda César ñucara taripahuachu nicani . Shina rasha judiogunara causayachingaj mana ansas charinichu .

text: For this cause therefore have I called for you , to see you , and to speak with you : because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain .
text2: Chiraigumanda cangunara cayashcani , cangunara ricusha rimangaj . Israel chapaushcamanda cai iru cadenahua huatai tucuni .

text: And they said unto him , We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee , neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee .
text2: Shinajpi paiguna Pabloma rimanauca , casna nisha : Ñucanchi Judea llactamanda mana ima quillcaras apishcanchi canmanda rimajta . Shinallara maican uquiunas mana shamushcachu canda causayachingaj . Canmanda mana ima manaliras rimanaushcachu .

text: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest : for as concerning this sect , we know that every where it is spoken against .
text2: Astaumbas canmanda imaras uyanara munanchi . Cai sami quirijgunara tucui partimanda uyanchi manali rimashcaunara .

text: And when they had appointed him a day , there came many to him into his lodging ; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God , persuading them concerning Jesus , both out of the law of Moses , and out of the prophets , from morning till evening .
text2: Shinajpi judioguna shu punzha tandaringaj rimanauca . Pablo huasima ashca runauna shamunauca . Paigunara Dios mandana pacha shimira rimaca . Moisés camachishca ley shimimanda Diosmanda rimajgunamandas Pablo paigunara Jesusmanda ricuchisha rimaca . Tutamanda pacha chishigama rimaca .

text: And some believed the things which were spoken , and some believed not .
text2: Huaquinguna pai rimashcara chasquinaucami , huaquingunaga mana quirinaucachu .

text: And when they agreed not among themselves , they departed , after that Paul had spoken one word , Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers ,
text2: Paigunapura mana pariju iyarinaupi , paiguna ringaj callarijpi , Pablo cai shimira rimaca : Santo Espíritu ñucanchi yayaunama alimi rimaca Diosmanda rimaj Isaías shimimanda :

text: Saying , Go unto this people , and say , Hearing ye shall hear , and shall not understand ; and seeing ye shall see , and not perceive :
text2: Cai runaunama ri , nica , paigunara rimai : Rinrihua uyashallara mana intindinguichi ; ñahuihua ricushallara mana ricsinguichi .

text: For the heart of this people is waxed gross , and their ears are dull of hearing , and their eyes have they closed ; lest they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and understand with their heart , and should be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Cai runauna shungu llashacyashcami ; rinriuna uyashallara upayanaushca , ñahuiunaras ishcanaushcami ; ama ñahuihua ricusha , ama rinrihua uyasha , ama shungüi intindinauchu , ama ñucama tigranauchu , ñuca paigunara ama alichingaj .

text: Be it known therefore unto you , that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles , and that they will hear it .
text2: Yachaichi , gentilgunama cai Diosmanda quishpichina shimira cachamushcami . Paiguna uyanaungami .

text: And when he had said these words , the Jews departed , and had great reasoning among themselves .
text2: Pablo caita rimashca huasha , judioguna paigunapura ashcara rimanausha rinauca .

text: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house , and received all that came in unto him ,
text2: Pabloga pai quiquin mañachishca huasii ishqui huata tupura tiaca , tucui paima shamujgunara chasquisha uyaca .

text: Preaching the kingdom of God , and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ , with all confidence , no man forbidding him .
text2: Pablo Dios mandana pacha ali shimira camachica , Señor Jesucristomanda yachachica pajlla pambai , mana imais arcarisha .

text: Paul , a servant of Jesus Christ , called to be an apostle , separated unto the gospel of God ,
text2: Pablo , Jesucristora sirvij , cayashca shu apóstol nishca Dios cachashca runa tucungaj , chicanyachishca aca Diospa evangelio shimira rimangaj .

text: ( Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures , )
text2: Dios ñaupa horasmanda cai evangelio shimira cusha nica paimanda rimajguna quillcashca santo Quillcaunai .

text: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord , which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh ;
text2: Cai Quillcauna paihua Churi ñucanchi Señor Jesucristomanda rimanauca . Paiga Davidpa miraigunamanda miraj aca paihua aichai .

text: And declared to be the Son of God with power , according to the spirit of holiness , by the resurrection from the dead :
text2: Paiga Diospa Churi nisha ushanahua rimashca aca , Santo Espiritumanda , huañushcaunamanda causarishca raigu .

text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship , for obedience to the faith among all nations , for his name :
text2: Paimanda gracia nishca yangamanda üaquishcara charinchi , apóstol nishca cachashca runauna tucusha , tucui llactauna evangelio shimira quirisha casungaj , paihua shutira llaquishcamanda .

text: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ :
text2: Cangunas chigunamanda anguichi , Jesucristojguna tucungaj cayashcauna .

text: To all that be in Rome , beloved of God , called to be saints : Grace to you and peace from God our Father , and the Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Tucui canguna Roma nishca llactai tiajgunama quillcauni , Dios llaquishcauna , chicanyachishcauna anguichi . Gracia nishca ali iyairas cushi shunguras charichi , ñucanchi Yaya Diosmanda , Señor Jesucristomandas .

text: First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all , that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world .
text2: Ñaupa punda , ñuca Diosta agrasini Jesucristomanda tucui cangunaraigu . Canguna quirishca entero mundui rimashcami .

text: For God is my witness , whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son , that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers ;
text2: Ñuca espiritui Diosta sirviuni paihua evangelio shimira rimausha . Paimi ricun imasnara mana saquishallara cangunara iyariuni ñuca Diosta mañashcaunai .

text: Making request , if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you .
text2: Diosta rugauni imasnais pai munajpi ñuca alira purisha cangunajma shamusha chari .

text: For I long to see you , that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift , to the end ye may be established ;
text2: Cangunara ricusha nini , shu almai cuyashcara cangunahua saquingaj , cangunara shinzhiyachingaj ;

text: That is , that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me .
text2: Casna nisha nini , ñuca cangunahua parijumanda cushi tucungaj , ñucanchi ishquindi quiriushcai , canguna quirishca ñuca quirishcas .

text: Now I would not have you ignorant , brethren , that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you , ( but was let hitherto , ) that I might have some fruit among you also , even as among other Gentiles .
text2: Munani , uquiuna , canguna yachangaj imasna ashca cuti cangunajma shamusha nicani , astaun cuna horasgama arcarishcani , ñuca cangunamanda ima aparishcara tupangaj , imasnara shu gentilgunamanda tupashcani .

text: I am debtor both to the Greeks , and to the Barbarians ; both to the wise , and to the unwise .
text2: Ñucaga griegounamas mana griegounamas , yachajgunamas mana yachajgunamas dibiyuj ani .

text: So , as much as in me is , I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also .
text2: Shinajpi , ñuca ushanagama , puruntu mani evangelio shimira rimangaj , canguna Romai tiajgunamas .

text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ : for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth ; to the Jew first , and also to the Greek .
text2: Ñucaga evangeliomanda mana pingarinichu . Caimi Diospa ushana tucui quirijgunara quishpichingaj , ñaupa punda judiogunama , shinallara griegounamas .

text: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith : as it is written , The just shall live by faith .
text2: Cai evangelioi Dios alichishca causana ricurimun quirinahua callarisha , quirinahua tucuringagama ; imasna quillcashca tian : Ali runa pai quirishcamanda causanga .

text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men , who hold the truth in unrighteousness ;
text2: Dios piñarishca ahua pachamanda ricurimun tucui paita mana ricsijgunamas , tucui manali rajgunamas , paiguna Diospa cierto shimira uyanara arcasha paiguna manali rashcaunamanda ;

text: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them ; for God hath shewed it unto them .
text2: Ima Diosmanda ricsishcaras , Dios chita paigunama ricuchicami .

text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen , being understood by the things that are made , even his eternal power and Godhead ; so that they are without excuse :
text2: Diosmanda mana ricuihuajguna , paihua huiñaigama ushana , pai Dios asnearas ali ricurimunaun , cai pacha rashca horasmanda . Caiguna intindinaushcami pai rashcaunamanda . Chi raigumanda runauna cutipanara mana ushanaunzhu , Mana yachacanichu , nisha .

text: Because that , when they knew God , they glorified him not as God , neither were thankful ; but became vain in their imaginations , and their foolish heart was darkened .
text2: Paigunaga Diosta ricsishallara , paita mana ahuayachinaucachu quiquin Dios cuenta , maspas paita mana agrasinauca . Astaumbas paiguna iyaushcai upa tucunauca , paiguna upa shungu llandu tucuca .

text: Professing themselves to be wise , they became fools ,
text2: Paiguna , umayujguna manchi , nisha , upauna tucunauca .

text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man , and to birds , and fourfooted beasts , and creeping things .
text2: Mana ismuihuaj Diospa sumaj ajta turcanauca , ismuihuaj runa samii , pishcuuna , chuscu chaquiyujguna , machacuiuna samiunais .

text: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts , to dishonour their own bodies between themselves :
text2: Chi raigumanda Dios paigunara cuca irusta rangaj paiguna shungu ucha munaibi , parijumanda paiguna aichara huajlichingaj .

text: Who changed the truth of God into a lie , and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator , who is blessed for ever . Amen .
text2: Diospa cierto shimira turcasha , llulla shimira uyanauca , tucuira raj Diosta randimanda pai rashcaunara alabanauca , ahuayachinauca . Paita alabashca achu huiñaigama . Amen .

text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections : for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature :
text2: Chi raigumanda Dios chigunara pinganaita munaira rangaj cuca , huarmiuna paigunama cushca rana samira saquisha , mana cushca samira ranauca .

text: And likewise also the men , leaving the natural use of the woman , burned in their lust one toward another ; men with men working that which is unseemly , and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet .
text2: Shinallara cariuna huarmiunahua puñunara saquisha , salinashca cuenta , irus ucha aicha munaibi caripura pinganaita rasha , paigunajpi paiguna irus rashcamanda paganara apinaun .

text: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge , God gave them over to a reprobate mind , to do those things which are not convenient ;
text2: Maspas , imasna paiguna Diosta iyarinara mana munanaupi , Dios paigunara saquica nuspasha causaibi causangaj , mana valijgunara rangaj .

text: Being filled with all unrighteousness , fornication , wickedness , covetousness , maliciousness ; full of envy , murder , debate , deceit , malignity ; whisperers ,
text2: Tucui manali ranara yapajta ranauca : Shujhua tacarina , irusta rana , cullquira yapajta munana , manalirana , shujpajta munasha ricuna , runara huañuchina , macanauna , umachinauna , manalira rimanauna ,

text: Backbiters , haters of God , despiteful , proud , boasters , inventors of evil things , disobedient to parents ,
text2: piñajguna , shimihua huajllchijguna , Diosta chijnijguna , camijguna , mas tucuisiquiuna , Atun mani nijguna , manalira rangaj iyajguna , yayaunara mana uyajguna ,

text: Without understanding , covenantbreakers , without natural affection , implacable , unmerciful :
text2: upauna , shimira mana pactachijguna , shungu Ülajguna , shinzhi shunguuna , mana llaquijguna .

text: Who knowing the judgment of God , that they which commit such things are worthy of death , not only do the same , but have pleasure in them that do them .
text2: Caigunaga Diospa taripanara intindisha , imasna casna rajguna huañuna anaun , cai samiunara ranaun , maspas casna rajgunara cariyachinaun .

text: Therefore thou art inexcusable , O man , whosoever thou art that judgest : for wherein thou judgest another , thou condemnest thyself ; for thou that judgest doest the same things .
text2: Chi raigumanda imaras rimanara mana ushanguichu , pi taripaj runas ; imais shujta taripangui canllarara causayachingui , can taripaj ashas cai samillara raungui .

text: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things .
text2: Astaun yachanchi imasna Dios tarípashca ciertomi tucui casna rajgunahua .

text: And thinkest thou this , O man , that judgest them which do such things , and doest the same , that thou shalt escape the judgment of God ?
text2: Canga casna rajgunara taripasha , shinallara chi tupullara raungui , ¿ iyanguichu can Diospa tarípanamanda quishpishami , nisha ?

text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering ; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance ?
text2: Canga , ¿ Diospa atun ali shungura , pai ahuantashcaras , paihua chapaisiqui shunguras pishiyachinguichu ? ¿ Manzhu ricsingui imasna paihua ali shungu canda arrepentiringaj pushamun ?

text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God ;
text2: Astaun camba shungu shinzhi ashcamanda , mana arrepentirishcamanda , piñarinara tandachingui can quiquinbajta , pinariña punzhai , Diospa ali justo taripana ricurina punzhai .

text: Who will render to every man according to his deeds :
text2: Diosga caran dueñora pai rashca tupura pagangami :

text: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality , eternal life :
text2: Ali rasha rajgunama , sumaj tucunaras , aü shutiras ; huiñai causaira mascajgunama Dios huiñai huiñai causaira pagangami .

text: But unto them that are contentious , and do not obey the truth , but obey unrighteousness , indignation and wrath ,
text2: Astaumbas camijgunama , cierto shimira mana uyajgunama , astaun manali shimira uyajguna asha , piñanaras piñarinaras pagangami .

text: Tribulation and anguish , upon every soul of man that doeth evil , of the Jew first , and also of the Gentile ;
text2: Tormendarinaras , turbarinaras , tucui manali raj runama pagangami , ñaupa punda judiogunama , shinallara griegounamas .

text: But glory , honour , and peace , to every man that worketh good , to the Jew first , and also to the Gentile :
text2: Astaumbas , sumaj tucunara , ali shutira , cungailla causanara pagashca anga tucui alira rajgunama , ñaupa punda judiogunama , shinallara griegounamas .

text: For there is no respect of persons with God .
text2: Dios tucui runaunara chi tupullara ricun .

text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law : and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law ;
text2: Tucui ley camachishca shimi illajguna camachishca shimi illajlla huañunaungami . Tucui camachishca shimii causajguna ucharajpiga , camachishca shimimanda taripashca anaunga .

text: ( For not the hearers of the law are just before God , but the doers of the law shall be justified .
text2: Ley camachishca shimira uyajgunalla mana ali tucunaunzhu Diospa ñaupajpi , astaun camachishca shimira rajgunami ali tucunaun .

text: For when the Gentiles , which have not the law , do by nature the things contained in the law , these , having not the law , are a law unto themselves :
text2: Gentilguna ley camachishca shimira mana charishallara , shinashas paiguna munaimandalla camachishca shimira pactachisha , caiguna camachishca shimira mana charishas , paiguna quiquinbajllara camachishca shimiyuj tucunaun .

text: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts , their conscience also bearing witness , and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another ; )
text2: Paiguna shina rasha , camachishca shimi yachachishcaunara paiguna shungüi quillcashca ajta ricuchinaun , paiguna iyaibi shina rimausha , paiguna iyaiguna huaquingunara causayachisha , huaquingunama lugarda cusha ,

text: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel .
text2: Señor taripana punzhai , imahoras runauna pacashcara Jesucristo tarípangami , ñuca evangelio shhnii rimashcasna .

text: Behold , thou art called a Jew , and restest in the law , and makest thy boast of God ,
text2: Canga , judio shutira charingui , ley camachishca shimiis samaungui , Diospi cushiyaungui ,

text: And knowest his will , and approvest the things that are more excellent , being instructed out of the law ;
text2: can Diospa munaira yachangui , ley camachishca shimii yachachishcamanda , ali ranara munaungui ,

text: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind , a light of them which are in darkness ,
text2: can iyaungui , ñausaunara ricuchij mani , llandui tiajguna punzha mani nisha ,

text: An instructor of the foolish , a teacher of babes , which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law .
text2: mana yachajgunara yachachij , huahuaunaras yachachij asha , ley camachishca shimii yachana tupura cierto shimi tupuras charingui .

text: Thou therefore which teachest another , teachest thou not thyself ? thou that preachest a man should not steal , dost thou steal ?
text2: Canga , shujta yachachij , ¿ manzhu can quiquinllarara yachachiungui ? Can , ama shuhuaichu , nisha rimaushallara , canga shuhuangui ?

text: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery , dost thou commit adultery ? thou that abhorrest idols , dost thou commit sacrilege ?
text2: Can , ama tacarichu nishallara , shujhua tacaringuichu ? Can runa rashca diosta chijnishallara , ¿ paihua huasira huajlichinguichu ?

text: Thou that makest thy boast of the law , through breaking the law dishonourest thou God ?
text2: Can ley camachishca shimii ahuayasha , leyra mana pactachisha ¿ Diosta mana valichinguichu ?

text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you , as it is written .
text2: Imasna quillcashca tian : Diospa shutira camishcami gentilgunai cangunaraigumanda .

text: For circumcision verily profiteth , if thou keep the law : but if thou be a breaker of the law , thy circumcision is made uncircumcision .
text2: Cierto pacha circuncisión nishcara rana valinmi , can ley camachishca shimira huacachijpi , astaumbas can ley shimira mana huacachijpi , can circuncisionda rashca mana valin , circuncisión illaj cuenta tucun .

text: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law , shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision ?
text2: Shinajpi , imahoras circuncisión illaj aj ley camachishca ranaunara huacachiun , ¿ manzhu chi circuncisión illaj aj ña circuncisionda rana cuenta tucunga ?

text: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature , if it fulfil the law , judge thee , who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law ?
text2: Maican runaga pagarimushcamanda circuncisión illaj asha , astaumbas ley camachishca shimira ali pacha huacachisha , canda causayachingami , can ley shimiras circuncisiondas charishallara , ley shimira mana huacachijpi .

text: For he is not a Jew , which is one outwardly ; neither is that circumcision , which is outward in the flesh :
text2: Mana judiochu canzhama aichallai ricurij , shinallara mana circuncisionzhu canzha aichallai ricurij .

text: But he is a Jew , which is one inwardly ; and circumcision is that of the heart , in the spirit , and not in the letter ; whose praise is not of men , but of God .
text2: Astaumbas shungu ucumanda aj judio cierto judiomi . Cierto circuncisionga shungu ucuimi , espiritui , mana quillcamandalla . Paihua alabana mana runamandachu , astaun Diosmandami .

text: What advantage then hath the Jew ? or what profit is there of circumcision ?
text2: ¿ Judio runa imaira yalin ? ¿ imajta valin circuncisión ?

text: Much every way : chiefly , because that unto them were committed the oracles of God .
text2: Ashcami , tucuibi . Ñaupa punda , paigunama Diospa shimira cushca aca .

text: For what if some did not believe ? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect ?
text2: ¿ Paigunamanda huaquinguna mana quirijguna ashca , imarai ? ¿ Paiguna mana quiríshcaga Diospa cierto shimira huajlichingachu ?

text: God forbid : yea , let God be true , but every man a liar ; as it is written , That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings , and mightest overcome when thou art judged .
text2: Mana pacha . Astaumbas , Dios cierto achu , maspas tucui runa llullaj achu , imasna quillcashcasna : Can ali tucuchu can tucui rimaushcaunai , vencingaj canda tarípaushcais .

text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance ? ( I speak as a man )
text2: Shinajpi , ñucanchi ucharashca Dios ali ajta yalichisha , ¿ imara nishun ? ¿ Manzhu Dios manali anga ucharashcara livachisha ? Runasna rimauni .

text: God forbid : for then how shall God judge the world ?
text2: Mana pacha . Shina tucujpi , ¿ imasnara Dios mundura taripanma ?

text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory ; why yet am I also judged as a sinner ?
text2: Astaun , ñuca llullamanda , Dios cierto ajta yalichishca ajpi paita ahuayachingaj , ¿ imarasha ñuca chara uchayuj cuenta taripai tucunichu ?

text: And not rather , ( as we be slanderously reported , and as some affirm that we say , ) Let us do evil , that good may come ? whose damnation is just .
text2: Shinallara , ¿ imarasha mana nishun : Uchara rangaichi ali tucungaj ? Huaquingunaga ñucanchira caminaun , paiguna casnami rimanaun , nisha . Paiguna causayachina ali anmaca .

text: What then ? are we better than they ? No , in no wise : for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles , that they are all under sin ;
text2: Shinajpi , ¿ imarai ? ¿ Ñucanchiga , paigunara yalinchichu ? Mana pacha . Ña causayachishcanchi judiogunaras gentilgunaras imasna paiguna tucui ucha mandashcai tianaun .

text: As it is written , There is none righteous , no , not one :
text2: Imasna quillcashca tian : Ali runa illan , mana shujllas tian .

text: There is none that understandeth , there is none that seeketh after God .
text2: Illan intindij runa , Diosta mascajpas illan .

text: They are all gone out of the way , they are together become unprofitable ; there is none that doeth good , no , not one .
text2: Tucui anzhurinaushca , pariju mana valijguna tucunaushca . Alira rajga illan , mana shujpas tianzhu .

text: Their throat is an open sepulchre ; with their tongues they have used deceit ; the poison of asps is under their lips :
text2: Paiguna tunguri pascaríshca pambana uctusna ; calluhua umachinaun ; machacui ambi paiguna shimii tian ;

text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness :
text2: Paiguna shimi manali shimihuas ayaj shimihuas undajta tian .

text: Their feet are swift to shed blood :
text2: Paiguna chaquiuna uctalla callpanaun yahuarda talingaj .

text: Destruction and misery are in their ways :
text2: Tularinas llaquirinas paiguna ñambiunai tianaun .

text: And the way of peace have they not known :
text2: Cushi causana nambira mana ricsinaushcachu .

text: There is no fear of God before their eyes .
text2: Paiguna ñahui ñaupajpi , Diosta manzhana mana tianzhu .

text: Now we know that what things soever the law saith , it saith to them who are under the law : that every mouth may be stopped , and all the world may become guilty before God .
text2: Shinajpi , caita yachanchi : Ley tucui ima rimashcaras ley mandashcai tiajgunama riman ; tucui shimi ishcarichu , tucui mundu Dios taripanai tiachu .

text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight : for by the law is the knowledge of sin .
text2: Ley shimira pactachina ranaunahua pi aichas mana alichishca tucunzhu Diospa ñaupajpi . Leymandaga uchara ricsi tucunmi .

text: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested , being witnessed by the law and the prophets ;
text2: Cuna leymanda chican , Dios alichishca ricurimunmi , ley nishca shimiis Diosmanda rimajguna shimiunais rimashcami .

text: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe : for there is no difference :
text2: Caimi Dios munashca ali causana , Jesucristoi quirishcamanda tucui paita quirijgunama , mana pitas chicanyachisha .

text: For all have sinned , and come short of the glory of God ;
text2: Tucui runauna ucharanaushcami , Diospa sumajmanda anzhurinaushcami ;

text: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus :
text2: Astaun , yangamanda alichishca anaun , Diospa gracia nishca yangamanda llaquishcaraigu , Cristo Jesús paigunara randishcamanda .

text: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood , to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past , through the forbearance of God ;
text2: Paitaga Dios ricuchica shu pagana cuenta , paihua yahuar talirishcamanda , quirishcah . ua chasqui tucungaj . Caitaga Dios rarca paihua ali shungura ricuchingaj , ñaupa horas ucha rashcaunara mana ricushcaraigu , pai chapaisiqui ashcamanda ,

text: To declare , I say , at this time his righteousness : that he might be just , and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus .
text2: cai horasllai , Dios pai ali ashcara ricuchingaj ; paiga ali tucuchu , shinallara Jesuspi quirijgunara alichingaj .

text: Where is boasting then ? It is excluded . By what law ? of works ? Nay : but by the law of faith .
text2: Shinajpi , ¿ alabarina tiangachu ? Illan . ¿ Ima sami leymanda ? ¿ Ali ranauna leymandachu ? Mana , astaumbas shu quirina leymandami .

text: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law .
text2: Shinasha ricsinchi imasnara shu runa ali tucun pai quirishcamandalla , ley ranauna illaj .

text: Is he the God of the Jews only ? is he not also of the Gentiles ? Yes , of the Gentiles also :
text2: Diosga , ¿ judiogunajllachu ? ¿ Manzhu shinallara gentilgunajpas ? Cierto , shinallara gentilgunajpa Diosmi .

text: Seeing it is one God , which shall justify the circumcision by faith , and uncircumcision through faith .
text2: Diosga shujllami . Pai circuncisionda apijgunara shinallara mana apijgunaras alichingami paiguna quirishcamanda .

text: Do we then make void the law through faith ? God forbid : yea , we establish the law .
text2: Shinajpi , ¿ ley shimira tulanchichu quirinamanda ? Mana pacha , astaun ley shimira shinzhiyachinchi .

text: What shall we say then that Abraham our father , as pertaining to the flesh , hath found ?
text2: Ñucanchi yaya Abrahanmandaga , ¿ imara nishun pai aichai rashcaunamanda ? Paiga , ¿ imara tupacachu ?

text: For if Abraham were justified by works , he hath whereof to glory ; but not before God .
text2: Abraham , pai rashcaunamanda ali tucushca asha , charinmi alabaringaj , astaumbas mana Diospa ñaupajpi .

text: For what saith the scripture ? Abraham believed God , and it was counted unto him for righteousness .
text2: ¿ Quillcashcaiga , imara nin ? Abraham Diospi quirica , nin , chimanda alimi nisha rimashca aca .

text: Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace , but of debt .
text2: Tarabaj runama , pai ganashca cullqui mana cuyashcasna iyanachu , astaun dibishcamanda .

text: But to him that worketh not , but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly , his faith is counted for righteousness .
text2: Maicans , mana tarabajpi , astaun manalira rajta alichij Diospi quirijpi , paihua quirina ali tucunami nishca anga .

text: Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man , unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works ,
text2: Imasna David shinallara riman : Cushimi shu runa imahoras ali ranaunara mana ricujllaira , Dios paita , Alimi angui , nin .

text: Saying , Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven , and whose sins are covered .
text2: Casna nisha : Cushiunami maicanguna ucharashcaunara perdonashca asha , maicanguna uchaunara quillpashcami .

text: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin .
text2: Cushimi maican runa Señor paita mana : Uchayuj angui , nijpi .

text: Cometh this blessedness then upon the circumcision only , or upon the uncircumcision also ? for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness .
text2: ¿ Cai cushi tucushcaga , circuncisionda apijgunamallachu ? ¿ manzhu shinallara circuncisionda mana apijgunamas ? Ña nishcanchi Abraham quirishcaga ali tucuna iyashca aca .

text: How was it then reckoned ? when he was in circumcision , or in uncircumcision ? Not in circumcision , but in uncircumcision .
text2: ¿ Imahoras pai ali tucushca iyashcachu aca ? ¿ pai circuncisionda rashca huashai , pai circuncisionda manara rashcai ? Mana pai circuncisionda rashca huashai , astaumbas manara rashcai .

text: And he received the sign of circumcision , a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had yet being uncircumcised : that he might be the father of all them that believe , though they be not circumcised ; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also :
text2: Abraham circuncisionda apica shu ricuchina cuenta , pai ñaupa horas quirishcamanda ali tucushca cierto ajta ricuchingaj , pai circuncisionda manara apijllaira . Chasna maca Abraham tucui circuncisionda mana apijgunamanda yaya tucungaj , paigunajmas paiguna quirina ali tucushca iyashca achu .

text: And the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only , but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham , which he had being yet uncircumcised .
text2: Shinallara yaya tucuca circuncisionda apijgunama , mana circuncisionllara apijgunamas , astaun shinallara ñucanchi yaya Abraham quirishca aitaushcai catijgunamas , imasna pai circuncisionda manara apishcai quirij aca .

text: For the promise , that he should be the heir of the world , was not to Abraham , or to his seed , through the law , but through the righteousness of faith .
text2: Dios cushca shimira Abrahanmas paihua miraigunamas mana cushcachu aca pai ley shimira pactachishcamanda , pai mundura apij tucungaj , astaun pai Diospi quirisha ali tucushcamanda .

text: For if they which are of the law be heirs , faith is made void , and the promise made of none effect :
text2: Shinajpi , ley shimira catijguna herederos nishca apijguna tucujpiga , quirina mana valinzhu , shimi cushcas mana sirvinzhu .

text: Because the law worketh wrath : for where no law is , there is no transgression .
text2: Leyga piñarinara apamun , astaun ley illajpi , uchas shinallara illanmi .

text: Therefore it is of faith , that it might be by grace ; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed ; not to that only which is of the law , but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham ; who is the father of us all ,
text2: Chiraigumanda Dios cushca shimira quirijgunama cushca aca , yanga llaquishcamanda cui tucungaj , shinallara cierto tucungaj tucui Abraham miraigunama . Mana leyra rajgunamalla cushca aca , astaun quirijgunamas , imasna Abraham quirishcasna . Shinajpi Abraham tucui ñucanchi yaya tucun ,

text: ( As it is written , I have made thee a father of many nations , ) before him whom he believed , even God , who quickeneth the dead , and calleth those things which be not as though they were .
text2: pai quirishca Diospa ñaupajpi ; imasna quillcashca tian : Canda ashca llactauna yayara churashcani . Diosga huañushcaunama causaira cun , shinallara illajgunara cayaun tiajgunara cuenta .

text: Who against hope believed in hope , that he might become the father of many nations ; according to that which was spoken , So shall thy seed be .
text2: Abrahanga , ima chapanaras mana charisha , chapashallara quiriuca , ashca llactaunahua yaya tucungaj , paita rimashcasna : Chasnallara camba miraiguna tucunaungami , nisha .

text: And being not weak in faith , he considered not his own body now dead , when he was about an hundred years old , neither yet the deadness of Sara ' s womb :
text2: Paiga mana sambayacachu pai quiriushcai , shinallara paihua aicha ña huañushcasna ajta mana riparacachu , pai ñaca patsac huatayuj ashallara , shinallara Sara huahua ricuna aicha huañushcaras mana riparacachu .

text: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief ; but was strong in faith , giving glory to God ;
text2: Shinallara pai Dios cushca shimira quiricami . Pactaringami , nisha . Maspas quirisha , pai shinzhi tucuca , Diosta ahuayachisha .

text: And being fully persuaded that , what he had promised , he was able also to perform .
text2: Abraham ali pacha yachaca imasnara tucui imaras Dios rasha nishcara , paihua shimira cusha , paimi ali pacha ushaca pactachingaj .

text: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness .
text2: Chiraigu pai quirishcamanda Dioshua alimi nishca aca .

text: Now it was not written for his sake alone , that it was imputed to him ;
text2: Cai shimi mana pai quiquinmallara quillcashcachu aca , pai alimi nishca asha ,

text: But for us also , to whom it shall be imputed , if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead ;
text2: astaun ñucanchimas , cai ali tucushca ñucanchimas iyashca anga , ñucanchi Señor Jesusta huañushcaunamanda atarichij Diospi quirijgunama .

text: Who was delivered for our offences , and was raised again for our justification .
text2: Paiga ñucanchi manali rashcaunamanda cushca aca , maspas causachishca aca ñucanchi alichishcauna tucungaj .

text: Therefore being justified by faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ :
text2: Dioshua alichishcauna manchi ñucanchi quirishcamanda , cushiras charinchi Dioshua , ñucanchi Señor Jesucristomanda .

text: By whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand , and rejoice in hope of the glory of God .
text2: Paimanda caí gracia nishca Dios llaquihuashcara apishcanchi quirishcamanda , chihui shinzhi shayarinchi shinallara cushiyanchi Diospa sumajta chapausha .

text: And not only so , but we glory in tribulations also : knowing that tribulation worketh patience ;
text2: Maspas , tormendarishcaunai cushiyanchi , caita yachasha : Tormendarinauna ahuantaj shungura iñachin ;

text: And patience , experience ; and experience , hope :
text2: Ahuantaj shungura Dios alimi nin ; Dios ali nishca shungumanda chapana iyai iñan ;

text: And hope maketh not ashamed ; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us .
text2: Shinallara chapana iyai mana pingachinzhu , Dios llaquishcara ñucanchi shungüi talishca aca ñucanchima cushca Santo Espiritumanda .

text: For when we were yet without strength , in due time Christ died for the ungodly .
text2: Ñucanchi chara irqui tono ajllaira , Dios cushca horaspi , Cristo manalúmamanda huañuca .

text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die : yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die .
text2: Ali runa randimanda shu runa huañunma chari . Astaun shu ali shungu runamanda , shu runa huañusha ninma .

text: But God commendeth his love toward us , in that , while we were yet sinners , Christ died for us .
text2: Astaumbas Dios pai quiquin llaquishcara ñucanchima ricuchin , ñucanchi chara uchayujguna ajllaira , Cristo ñucanchi randimanda huañuca .

text: Much more then , being now justified by his blood , we shall be saved from wrath through him .
text2: Maspas , ñucanchi cuna Dioshua ali tucusha Cristo yahuarmanda , paimanda Dios piñarishcara quishpishun .

text: For if , when we were enemies , we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son , much more , being reconciled , we shall be saved by his life .
text2: Ñucanchi , chijnijguna ashallara , Dioshua amigopura tucucanchi paihua Churi huañushcaraigu , astaun mas cuna amigopura asha , quishpichi tucushun pai causashcamanda .

text: And not only so , but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , by whom we have now received the atonement .
text2: Maspas , Diospi cushiyanchi , ñucanchi Señor Jesucristomanda , cunaga paimanda amigopura tucushcanchi .

text: Wherefore , as by one man sin entered into the world , and death by sin ; and so death passed upon all men , for that all have sinned :
text2: Chiraigumanda imasna shu runamandalla ucha mundui icuca , uchamanda huañuis icuca , shinallarami huañui tucui runaunama shamuca , paiguna tucui ucharashcamanda ,

text: ( For until the law sin was in the world : but sin is not imputed when there is no law .
text2: Ley shimi manara tiaushcai , ucha mundui tiauca , astaumbas ley illajpi , ucha mana ricurinzhu .

text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses , even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam ' s transgression , who is the figure of him that was to come .
text2: Shinajllaira huañui mandaca Adanmanda Moisesgama , Adán ucharashca samira mana rajgunamas . Adanga huasha shamungarau Ruñara ricuchijmi .

text: But not as the offence , so also is the free gift . For if through the offence of one many be dead , much more the grace of God , and the gift by grace , which is by one man , Jesus Christ , hath abounded unto many .
text2: Dios yanga cuyashcaga mana ucha samichu aca . Shu runa manali rashcamandalla ashcauna huañunauca , maspas ashcaunama Diospa gracia nishca yangamanda llaquishca yaparica . Shinallara Dios cuyashca shu runa yanga llaquishcamanda yaparica . Cai runa Jesucristomi .

text: And not as it was by one that sinned , so is the gift : for the judgment was by one to condemnation , but the free gift is of many offences unto justification .
text2: Shinallara Dios yangamanda cuyashca mana shu runa ucharashca cuentallachu aca . Taripana cierto pacha shu uchamanda shamuca , causayachingaj , astaun Dios cuyashcaga ashca uchauna raigumanda shamuca runaunara Dioshua alichishca tucungaj .

text: For if by one man ' s offence death reigned by one ; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one , Jesus Christ . )
text2: Shu runa ucharashcamandalla , huañui mandaca . Cunaga maspas shu sapalla Jesucristomanda ashca gracia nishcaras Dioshua alichina cuyashcaras apijguna causaibi mandanaungami .

text: Therefore as by the offence of one judgment came upon all men to condemnation ; even so by the righteousness of one the free gift came upon all men unto justification of life .
text2: Shinajpi , imasna shu ucharashcamandalla taripana tucui runaunama shamuca causayachingaj , shinallara shu ali ranara rashcamandalla gracia nishca shamuca tucui runaunama , paiguna causaibi Dioshua alichishca tucungaj .

text: For as by one man ' s disobedience many were made sinners , so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous .
text2: Chi raigumanda imasna shu runa mana casushcamandalla ashcauna uchayuj tucunauca , shinallara shu Runa casushcamandalla ashcauna Dioshua ali tucunaungami .

text: Moreover the law entered , that the offence might abound . But where sin abounded , grace did much more abound :
text2: Ley shimiga icucami uchara yapachingaj , astaumbas ucha mirarijpi gracia nishca Dios yangamanda llaquishca yalijta yaparica .

text: That as sin hath reigned unto death , even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: Shinajpi , imasna ucha mandaca huañunagama , shinallara gracia mandachu Dios alichishca causanamanda huiñai causaigama , ñucanchi Señor Jesucristomanda .

text: What shall we say then ? Shall we continue in sin , that grace may abound ?
text2: Shinajpi , ¿ imara nishun ? ¿ uchara rasha catishunzhu gracia nishca yaparingaj ?

text: God forbid . How shall we , that are dead to sin , live any longer therein ?
text2: Mana pacha . Ñucanchi ucharangaj huañushcauna asha , ¿ imarasha cuti ucharanai causashun ?

text: Know ye not , that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death ?
text2: ¿ Manzhu yachanguichi imasna tucui ñucanchi Cristo Jesuspi bautisashcauna paihua huañuibi bautisashca acanchi ?

text: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death : that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father , even so we also should walk in newness of life .
text2: Paihua pariju pambashca anchi huañuibi ñucanchi bautisarishcai . Imasna Cristo huañushcaunamanda causarimuca Yaya sumaj ushanamanda , shinallara ñucanchi mushuj causaibi purishunchi .

text: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death , we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection :
text2: Ñucanchi Cristohua pariju tarpushca ashaga pai huañushca tonoi , shinallara paihua pariju ricurimushun pai causarishca tonoi .

text: Knowing this , that our old man is crucified with him , that the body of sin might be destroyed , that henceforth we should not serve sin .
text2: Caita yachanchi : Ñucanchi rucu runa , ñucanchi rucu causai , Cristohua pariju chacatashca aca , ucha aicha tucuchingaj , ñucanchi ama mas ucharanara sirvingaj .

text: For he that is dead is freed from sin .
text2: Huañushca runaga ucharanamanda ña alichishcami .

text: Now if we be dead with Christ , we believe that we shall also live with him :
text2: Ñucanchi Cristohua pariju huañushaga , paihua pariju causashun nisha , quirinchi .

text: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more ; death hath no more dominion over him .
text2: Caita yachasha : Cristo huañushcaunamanda causarishca asha , mana cuti huañunzhu . Huañui paita cuti mana mandanzhu .

text: For in that he died , he died unto sin once : but in that he liveth , he liveth unto God .
